texts.en: Reginah is a married woman. She describes herself to be talkative. She operates a motorcycle transport business where she transports customers using a motorcycle, as well as a retail shop. Her business is located in an urban area where there are many customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stock to start a retail shop. Her business goal is to have a taxi and a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stock to start a retail shop

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en:
Fidelis has one child. She describes herself to be good person. 

Fidelis operates a secretarial shop where she makes photocopies and prints documents for customers. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an urban area where customers are many. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy photocopy and printing paper and other items needed for her secretarial service. Her business goal is to have another photocopying machine within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully

loans.use: to buy photocopy and printing paper and other items needed for her secretarial service

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Pictured in the photo above is Samuel, a welder at one of the sugar companies in Sierra Leone. Samuel has been working at the sugar company for years.  

A native of Magburaka town, Samuel is married to a businesswoman and has five children – four are attending primary school and one is in secondary school. 

Samuel is currently building a house for his family. He has requested this loan to buy bags of cements for the completion of his house.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement for the completion of his house.

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es: Raymundo tiene 68 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos ya mayores, desde hace 12 años es cliente de la institución y su negocio es el destace de cerdo, cuenta con dos trabajadores remunerados, a y parte del destace vende nacatamales en su domicilio y en su comunidad es bien reconocido por la calidad de los nacatamales y el resto de producto de la carne de cerdo. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cerdo en pie y materia prima para elaborar nacatamales como carne de cerdo, hojas de chagüites, mecates, arroz, papa, cebolla, chiltoma, ajo, sal, naranja agria, achiote, maíz, cal, leñas etc.
texts.en: Raymundo is 68-years old, married and has two grown children.  He has been a client of the institution for twelve years.  His business is butchering pigs.  He has two paid employees.  In addition to butchering, Raymundo sells "nacatamales" (a local dish of corn, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaves) from his home.  He is well-known in his community for the quality of his "nacatamales" and the rest of his pork products.  Raymundo will invest the loan in the purchase of live pigs and raw materials for making " nacatamales," like pork, banana leaves, cord, rice, potatoes, onion, chilies, garlic, salt, bitter oranges, annatto, corn, lime, firewood etc.

loans.use: with the purchase of live pigs and raw materials for making "nacatamales" (a local dish of corn, meat and rice wrapped in banana leaf), like banana leaves, pork, cords, rice, potatoes, onion, chilies, garlic, salt, bitter orange, annatto, corn, lime, firewood etc.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is 52 years old and married with two children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a motorcycle repair shop in the local community to earn a living. He has been in this business for over 13 years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. 

Modesto has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional materials for his shop. In the future, he wants to improve his house and the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for his motorcycle repair shop.

loans.name: Madel

texts.en:
This is Madel. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy the computer parts that she needed in her computer shop. The loan and the income from her business helped her family with their everyday expenditures and the education of their children. Madel and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Madel would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan to buy parts and cover maintenance costs for her computer shop. The profits from her business will definitely help her to continue to provide for her family's needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Madel hopes to open another branch in another location, and she hopes that her children will finish their studies. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work and to find strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for computer parts and maintenance needed in her business.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is a 62-year-old, widowed mother of five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Luz has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more items to sell, like bread, soft drinks, sardines, and other groceries.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell, like bread, soft drinks, sardines, and other groceries.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en:
Ambrosia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Ambrosia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle. 

Ambrosia has been in this business for five years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her tricycle

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Ruth works hard to support her family.

She has a food production business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs. Ruth is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ruth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rahoma

texts.en:
Rahoma is 38 years old, married, with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To earn a living, Rahoma owns and operates a retail business in the local community. She has been in her business for over three years and earns PHP 1,200 every month. 

She joined Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC) in 2010 and now she has requested a loan of PHP 3,500 to purchase additional products to sell.  

In the future, Rahoma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lucina works hard to support her family.

She has a business raising livestock in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling Avon products. Lucina is borrowing 24,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock for her livestock business.

Lucina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for her business.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from rice sales and a manicure businesses. Haydee is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Haydee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to stock her general store.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is 40 years old and married with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a business selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. She has been in this business for over four years and earns 6,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011, and now she has requested a loan of 11,500 PHP to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Tsetsegjargal

texts.en:
Borrower Ms.Tsetsegjargal is a married 43-year-old woman. She lives with her husband, two daughters and son in the capital city, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, in the outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure. She supports her family by operating a small grocery store business, while her spouse is working as a truck driver. 

Her elder two daughters are graduating from universities, so Tsetsegjargal needs more money to spend for their graduation expenses and pay off the last tuition fees. 

Thus, Tsetsegjargal is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to pay tuition fees and also spend on graduation expenses.

loans.use: to pay her daughters' tuition fees and graduation expenses.

loans.name: Girasol Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por cinco socios emprendedores una de ellas es Rosa es una mujer soltera, con 37 años de edad, con tres hijos de 05, 19 y 21 años de edad, desde hace 20 años se dedica a vender refrescos naturales en un mercado cercano a su localidad, su mama y su hija mayor le ayudan atender el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como frutas como naranja, guayaba de frescos, calala, piñas, granadillas, papaya, gaseosas variadas. Además va invertir en hacer mejoras a su tramo con el cambio de piso de cerámica y la compra de repostería. Eva tiene 52 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de la Avon, Sugey tiene 32 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de cosméticos de la Avon, María tiene 50 años y su negocio es la venta de pizzas y cosméticos de la Zelsa y Roger tiene 44 años y su negocio es un taller de confección.
texts.en:
This group is made up of five entrepreneurs, one of whom is Rosa, 37. She is single with three children, ages 5, 19, and 21. 

She has been selling natural soft drinks for twenty years in a market close to her home. Her mother and her oldest daughter help her run the business. She will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients, such as oranges, guavas, passionfruit, pineapples, papayas, and soda water. She will also invest in making improvements to her business space by changing the ceramic floor and buying pastries. 

Eva is 52 and makes a living selling Avon cosmetics. Sugey is 32 and also has a business selling Avon cosmetics. María is 50 and has a business selling pizza and Zelsa cosmetics. Roger is 44 and has a tailor's workshop.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for soft drinks, such as oranges, fresh guavas, passionfruit, pineapples, papayas, soda water, etc.

loans.name: I Ketut

texts.en:
I Ketut lives with his wife, son, and daughter. His wife is a housewife and helps manage their pig raising business. Currently, I Ketut has four sows and seven fattening pigs. Although the business is still small in scale, it is enough to help provide for his family.

Currently, I Ketut is not able to fully utilize the waste generated from his pig raising business, which causes some pollution. After being informed about the conversion of sewage waste into biogas, I Ketut became enthusiastic about the possibilities for his own business to create environmentally friendly energy and organic fertilizer. He hopes to gain maximum results from his business, take part in environmental conservation efforts, as well as making his business a model for surrounding communities.

loans.use: to build a biogas reactor.

loans.name: Jovelinda

texts.en:
Jovelinda is 54 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jovelinda has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years, and she also earns an income from selling herbal medicines.

Jovelinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: 3.05.278.08.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Oanh has a retail business selling metals. She is requesting a loan to purchase iron and aluminum goods to sell.

Oanh is 42 years old and she is married, with two children. She is the group leader of the 3.05.278.08.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of five members. Oanh supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Oanh's first loan with the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Oanh has been involved in her business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Oanh hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase iron and aluminum goods to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Alicia

texts.es: Doña Blanca vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijas tiene un negocio de pasteleria desde hace varios años elabora pasteles para bodas, cumpleaños, quinceaños, etc. tambien elabora quesadillas de queso, tiene mucha clientela pues los da ha buen precio; su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, Doña Blanca solicita un credito que le permita comprar productos como: harina, colorantes comestibles, crema pastelera, dulces, queso para elaborar quesadillas y todo lo necesario para poder seguir con su negocio y poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Doña Blanca lives in her own home with her husband and her daughters.  She has had a bakery business for a few years.  She makes cakes for weddings, birthdays, "quinceaños" (a celebration of a girl's 15th birthday) etc.  She also makes cheese quesadillas.  She has a large clientele because she sells her baked goods at a good price.  She runs her business out of her home.  Doña Blanca is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase products such as: flour, food coloring, cream, candies, cheese for making quesadillas and everything she needs to keep her business going and continue giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase products needed for making pastries: flour, sugar, candies etc.

loans.name: Maria Senelia

texts.es: María Senelia, una humilde señora que busca como salir adelante junto a su familia, continua laborando en un Cyber Café, aun con sus ingresos muy bajos ella siempre aspira a mejorar su viviebda pero debido a la dificultad económica solicita un sexto crédito para seguir mejorando su casita, esta vez le dará fino al anexo de cuarto que construyo con el préstamo anterior y así darle mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos y verlos crecer en un buen ambiente, siempre contando con la ayuda de su esposo.
texts.en:
María Senelia is a humble woman who searches for ways to provide for her family. She is still working for an internet café. Even with her very low income, she always aspires to improve her home. However, due to her financial difficulties, she is applying for a sixth loan to continue improving her house. 

This time, she will finish the addition of a room which she built with a previous loan, thus giving a better quality of life to her children so that she can see them grow up in a good atmosphere. She can always count on her husband's help.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 68 years old and widowed. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a food vending business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for over nine years and earns 4,000 PHP every month. 

She joined GDMPC in 2010, and now she has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP ro purchase additional foods to sell. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: ro purchase additional foods to sell.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 34 years old and a married mother of one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Lina has a seafood culture (talabahan) business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy bamboo, binder clips, fishing nets, and other equipment.

In the future, Lina would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binder clips, fishing nets, and other equipment.

loans.name: Tsetsgee's Group

texts.en:
Tsetsegee is a 44-year-old woman who lives with her younger son in the outer ger district, which lacks the basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her two elder sons are married, and she supports her family by operating a retail stall business in the indoor market. 

Tsetsegee imports her products from another large outdoor market and also from China.

With this loan, she wants to purchase more goods and products to sell and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to increase her working capital.

loans.name: 3.14.277.05.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thái has a service business shipping goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase a boat to do a sand transportation service. Thái has been involved in this business for more than ten years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital.

Thái is 59 years old and she is married with three children. Her children are grown up, so Thái supports no dependents with her business, which is in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Thái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thái is the group leader of the 3.14.277.05.Thiệu Khánh Solidarity group, which consists of six members.

With her business profit, Thái hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a boat to do a sand transport service.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is 51 years old, married and the mother of 10 children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she earns a living by owning and operating a coconut plantation. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in 2011 and is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy harvesting equipment. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve and expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy harvesting equipment for her farm.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Doña Ana vive en casa propia con su padre, ella tiene un negocio de tortilleria es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora tiene 15 años de tener su negocio tiene mucha clientela trabaja de lunes a domingo con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Doña Ana solicita un crediro que le permita comprar mas maiz por mayor para seguir con su negocio pues ese es su unica fuente de trabajo y asi obtener mas ganancias para tener una mejor vida con su padre.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own home with her father and has a tortilla-making business. She is a friendly and hardworking woman. She has had her business for 15 years, and she has many customers. She works from Monday to Sunday. With the earnings from her business, she is able to cover her home expenses. 

Ana is applying for a loan which will allow her to buy wholesale corn to continue with her business, which is her only source of income. This will allow her to obtain a higher income so that she can have a better life with her father.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Nom

texts.en:
Nom is 58 years old. She is a widowed resident of Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been making a living through animal husbandry for more than ten years, earning approximately 3 USD a day. Her children are employed as garment workers. They earn about 7 USD each day. 

Due to lack of funds, Nom is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase timber and zinc to fix her house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. She wants to purchase farmland for cultivating rice to generate extra income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to fix her house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Getafe, Bohol. Teresita makes bamboo fish traps, and her husband is a farmer. 

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy more bamboo for making fish traps, which she can then sell to local fishermen. In the future, Teresita hopes to make more fish traps and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more bamboo for making fish traps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chicken, meat, vegetables, chairs, tables, etc.

loans.name: 3.12.276.47.tt Van Ha Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hiền is 26 years old, and she is married with two children. She supports two dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. 

Hiền has a service business taking photographs. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain her wedding photography business. Hiền has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Hiền is the group leader of the 3.12.276.47.TT Van Ha solidarity group, which consists of five members.

In 2011, Hiền joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hiền has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her new profits, Hiền hopes for her business to do well so she can buy land of her own and make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase instruments for her photography business.

loans.name: Crisanto

texts.en:
Crisanto is 42 years old and married with seven children. He lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He owns and operates a banana farm to earn a living. He has been in this business for over five years and earns 2,000 PHP every month. 

Crisanto joined GDMPC in 2010, and now he has requested a loan of 4,500 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, he wants to make improvements on his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Nelmalita

texts.en:
This is Nelmalita. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a retail business for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. Having more items to sell will result in a better profit. Her profits from her business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s educational expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nelmalita hopes that her business will continue to grow and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Tseren

texts.en:
Mrs. Tseren, 43 years old, lives with her family in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. The family resides in a Mongolian traditional ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She has been working in the service sector since 2009, and she is considered a good, skilled worker by her managers. Her husband has been working as a security officer for almost four years. In his spare time, he also renders taxi service to local people in order to generate additional income for his family. 

Tseren and her family came from the countryside to Darkhan City in 2006 and began building their own house. Now the house is almost completed and some interior walls and window insulation remain.

Tseren is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase fiberglass, foam, cotton, and straw. Using these materials, she and her husband can add insulation to their house. An insulated house will enable the family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and thus contribute to efforts against air pollution. Tseren is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future as evidenced by her migration into an urban area.

loans.use: to purchase insulation materials.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic works hard to support her family. She is married and has a variety store business in the Philippines.

Marivic requested a 35,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un is 44 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fruits for more than two years, earning approximately 10 USD per day. Her husband, who joins her in the picture, helps her run the business. In order to improve her family’s finances, Un is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase more fruits for resale. By doing so, she would be able to earn more profits. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits for resale.

loans.name: 3.9.280.09.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Loan works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Loan is 46 years old, married, and has two children.

Loan is the group leader of the 3.9.280.09.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of seven members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province. She has no dependents, as her children are grown.

In 2012, Loan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Loan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Loan hopes to buy land of her own and more supplies and equipment for her business. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Vailoa

texts.en:
Vailoa is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells pancakes, sandwiches, noodle dishes, etc. in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience in this business.

Vailoa became a member of SPBD this year. She is applying for a 1000 WST loan to buy the ingredients she uses in her business. She plans to use her profits to help pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she uses in her business.

loans.name: 3.12.275.48.tt Van Ha Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ước is 26 years old, and she is married with one child. She has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. Ước has been involved in this business for four years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Ước is the group leader of the 3.12.275.48.TT Van Ha solidarity group, which consists of six members. Ước supports one dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Ước joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ước has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her new profits, Ước hopes for her business to do well so she can make enough money to provide for her kids and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is from Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. To make a living, Gina manages a banana production business. She has been in this business for 12 years and earns 12,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 28,500 PHP, which will be used to buy farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy farm chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more shoes to sell for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Sopheara

texts.en:
Sopheara is 32 years old. She is single and resides with her mother in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running a tailoring shop for more than three years, earning approximately USD 13 daily. Her mother is involved in breeding pigs. She makes an income of $2 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s income, Sopheara is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase cloth to use in her shop. In addition, a part of this money will be used to purchase piglets to breed. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, Sopheara would like to expand her shop and rebuild her house to make it more convenient for the family.

loans.use: to purchase cloth to use in her shop.

loans.name: Masturakhon

texts.ru: Мастурахон замужняя женщина с двумя детьми. Ей 38 лет. Она проживает в районе Дж.Руми на юге Таджикистана. Ее муж в данное время находится на заработках за пределами страны. Мастурахон по характеру трудолюбивая и усердная женщина. Она уже в течение 7 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Климат и погодные условия ее района благоприятствуют разведению теплолюбивых культур. Мастурахон арендует земельный участок, на котором выращивает хлопок. Это как известно кропотливый труд. Сейчас Мастурахон запрашивает кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений и топлива для обработки урожая хлопка.
texts.en: Masturakhon is a married woman with two children.  She is 38 years old.  She lives in the J. Rumy district in the south of Tajikistan.  Her husband is currently working abroad.  Masturakhon is a hardworking and diligent woman.  She has been involved in agriculture for 7 years.  Her district's climate and weather conditions are beneficial for growing warmth-loving plants.  Masturakhon leases a land plot, where she grows cotton.  This is well-known as a difficult task.  Currently, Masturakhon is requesting a loan to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel to treat her cotton crop.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and fuel to treat her cotton crop

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Doña Mercedes de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hijo de 23 años y su esposo . Ella posee un taller de costura en el lugar de su residencia donde confecciona diferentes tipos de prendas, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela porque el trabajo que ella realiza es excelente y los elabora a precios realmente accesibles; élla es una mujer muy dedicado a su trabajo responsable y honesta, Doña mercedes esta solicitando un crédito que le permita comprar: telas, hilos, agujas, botones y todo lo relacionado con la costura para seguir satisfaciendo la necesidad de los clientes y asi ella y su familia podran tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 52, lives in her own house with her son, 23, and her husband.

She has a tailor shop in her home where she makes different types of garments.  She has acquired a lot of customers lately because her work is excellent and she makes her garments at truly affordable prices.  She's a responsible and honest woman who's very dedicated to her work.

Mercedes is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, needles, buttons, and everything related to sewing so she can continue to satisfy the needs of her customers.  This way she and her family will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 54 years old and married, with five children.

Raquel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Raquel has borrowed and paid 24 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and she also earns an income from raising livestock.

Raquel aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a hog-raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Betty has been in this business for nine years. She earns additional income from food-vending.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de tortillas. Ella vive con su familia, su hijo de 22 años de edad y su compañero de vida; el negocio lo aprendió con su familia, lo realiza todos los días con la ventaja que lo lleva a cabo en la casa y desventaja es que hay mucha competencia. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de gas y maíz para tener en existencia. Este le ayudara para adquirir suficiente producto para la fabricación de tortillas.
Su sueño es ofrecerle una mejor estabilidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
María makes a living from selling tortillas. She lives with her family, her 22-year-old son and her life partner. She learned this business with her family. She works every day with the advantage that she does so at home and the disadvantage that there is a lot of competition.

The loan she needs will be invested in the purchase of gas and corn to have in stock. This will help her to acquire enough products to make tortillas.

Her dream is to offer her family a better stability of life.

loans.use: to buy gas and corn to have in stock

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назира  женщина в возрасте 43 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Сама Назира занимается животноводством и деканством. В деканстве они в основном занимаются  выращиванием картошки. Но основной доход у нее от скотоводства.   Назире помогает в животноводстве ее сын. Дополнительный доход в семье от мужа который  работает в России и каждый месяц отправляет по мере возможности денежные средства своей семье.  
Назира хочет построить новый дом для своего сына и деньги которые она накопила  не хватает.  От своих знакомых она узнала про организацию Арванд и решила подать заявку.  На полученный кредит Назира планирует начать стройку дома и купить строительные материалы.  Заранее благодарит организацию Арванд за поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Nazira is a 43 year-old woman.  She is married and has three children.  Nazira is involved in animal husbandry and farming.  She primarily grown potatoes at a dekhan farm.  Her primary income, however, comes from animal husbandry.  Nazira's son helps her with the animal husbandry business.  Additional income comes from her husband, who works in Russia and sends as much money as possible to the family every month.  Nazira wants to build a new house for her son, but the money she saved is not enough.  She learned about the Arvand organization from her friends and decided to make a request.  Nazira plans to use this loan to begin building the house and buy construction materials.  She thanks Arvand in advance for the support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a new house

loans.name: Naveeda's Group

texts.en:
Naveeda is a 42-year-old woman. She has excellent tailoring skills. Since 2000, she has been running a tailoring business in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and three daughters. 

Presently Naveeda is in need of purchasing a tailoring machine because her previous machine had stopped working. Due to this, she is unable to generate any amount of income. Therefore, as a member of three-person lending group, Naveeda has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a tailoring machine. This will help her to continue her business. She is thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a seafood culture business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store.  Susan is borrowing PHP 17,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy nylon, binder clips, bamboo, and other equipment for her seafood culture business.

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy nylon, binder clips, bamboo, and other equipment for her seafood culture business.

loans.name: Nurhali

texts.ru:
Нурхали житель района Дж.Руми, расположенного в южной части Таджикистана. Ему 61 год. У него жена и трое взрослых детей. Старший сын уехал на заработки в заграницу. 
У Нурхали высшее образование. Он в течение 25 лет работал учителем. Одновременно Нурхали занимается сельским хозяйством вот уже 10 лет. Около дома у него имеется участок орошаемой земли, на котором он выращивает огородные культуры. Нурхали берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений для обработки урожая помидора и огурцов. Он надеется получить богатый урожай помидора и огурцов и за счет прибыли с их продажи он хочет женить старшего сына.
texts.en: Nurhali is a resident of the J. Rumy district, located in the southern part of Tajikistan.  He is 61 years old, married and has three adult children.  His oldest son left to work abroad.  Nurhali has a higher education.  He spent 25 years working as a teacher.  Concurrently, Nurhali has been involved in agriculture for 10 years now.  He has a plot of irrigated land near his home, where he grows garden crops.  Nurhali is requesting this loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for treating his tomato an cucumber crops.  He hopes to gather a rich harvest of tomatoes and cucumbers and use the profit from its sale to marry off his oldest son.

loans.use: purchase mineral fertilizers for treating his tomato an cucumber crops

loans.name: Khalzaa

texts.en:
Borrower Khalzaa, a 41-year-old married father of four daughters and one son, lives with his family in Darkhan city, Mongolia. His elder daughter attends university; his youngest daughter attends kindergarten, while his other three children are in high school. His wife works in a kindergarten.

Khalzaa supports his family by offereing taxi and public transportation with his car. As the warm season begins, he wants to make some repairs to his car to improve his service and buy some construction materials, so he is requesting this Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and auto repair tools.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is 53 years old and married with five children.  She earns a living by raising hogs in the Philippines.  Corazon is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.  Corazon has been in this business for 5 years and she earns additional income from a general store.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Hameeda's Group

texts.en: Hameeda is a 55-year-old woman living in Lahore, Pakistan.  She is a mother of 5 children.  Due to financial problems she is experiencing a very difficult time.  Her husband owns a cloth-dyeing shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family.  Hameeda has requested a loan amount from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband purchase different colors for dyeing clothes.  With the profits she wants to improve the condition of her house.  She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase colors for dyeing clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix up his barber shop and put in glass windows.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Doña maria de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija, es una mujer luchadora y responsable para que a su familia no le falte lo necesario. Actualmente trabaja vendiendo comida cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años tiene mucha clientela fija pues da a un buen precio el plato de comida. Doña Maria desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas y sillas pues con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder comprarlas y asi pueda tener mas clientela y tener un poco mas de entrada económicamente, es por eso que solicita un crédito para comprar lo dicho; y asi darle a su familia necesario sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old and lives in a house she owns with her husband and her daughter. She is a responsible woman who strives so that her family won't be lacking what it needs. 

Currently, she works selling food near her home. She has had a large fixed clientele for the last 2 years, as she gives a good price to a plate of food. Maria wants to expand her food stall by buying tables and chairs, as what she earns isn't enough to be able to buy them. She will thus be able to have more clientele and have a bit more income. This is why she is asking for a loan, and to give her family what it needs without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant business

loans.name: Edis Estela

texts.es:
La Joven Edis de 29  años de edad, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de tortillas, vende por encargo y sale a entregar las tortillas a sus vecinos que viven cerca de su casa.
Edis es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superarse, está solicitando  el préstamo  para compra cargas de maíz y  leña, porque que se las están dando a buen precio y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad además la demanda que tiene de clientes requiere comprarlo para así tenerlo almacenado y no estar comprando por partes.   
Edis su sueño mejorar su casa de habitación.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril  del 2013.
texts.en:
Edis, 29, lives in her house in a small town in San Lorenzo, Valle, in the southern part of Honduras.  She makes a living selling tortillas.  She sells on order and goes out to deliver the tortillas to her customers who live near her house.  Edis is a very hardworking person who wants to improve herself.

She's requesting the loan to buy loads of corn and firewood.  She's getting a good price and wants to take advantage of this opportunity.  Also, customer demand requires that she buy it to have in storage so she doesn't have to buy in small portions.

Edis dreams of improving her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, April 2013

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood

loans.name: Purevdulam

texts.en: Ms. Purevdulam is a 39-year-old married lady who lives with her spouse in Darkhan city.  She currently lives in a ger (traditional Mongolian felt tent) and her long-term plan is to build a house at her yard.  But first, she needs to add a paling (fence).  She is applying for a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase palings.

loans.use: to purchase paling (fencing) for her yard.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is a 44-year-old married woman and a mother of four children from Talibon, Bohol.  Trinidad is engaged in coconut buying and copra making.  Trinidad is asking for a loan to buy more coconut for copra making.

In the future, Trinidad hopes to expand her business in order to generate more income necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut for copra making.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a business of selling dried fish in the Philippines. She explains that she earns additional income from her work at a general store.

Angelita is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 19,000 PHP through NWTF, which she would use to buy more dried fish to sell to her customers. Angelita has been sustaining her business activities through 19 prior loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva loans. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional dried fish for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a 44-year-old, married woman with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a pig-raising (for sale) business in her local community. She has been in this business for over six years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP per month from these activities.

She joined GDMPC in 2009. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing feed for her pigs

loans.name: Germelyn

texts.en:
Germelyn is a 28-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have three children, one of whom is in school.

Germelyn is in the agricultural business. Specifically, she raises livestock in the Philippines. Germelyn explains that she has been in this business for three years.

Germelyn is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy vaccines and other supplies for her livestock. Notably, she has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business. Germelyn is hoping to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica de 36 años de edad , esta casada y  tiene 03 hijos de 16, 10 y 07 años respectivamente por quienes se esfuerza por salir adelante, vive cómodamente en su propia su casa.Jessica se dedica a la venta de libros, cuadernos, lapiceros, entre otros;  para esto cuenta con un local que está instalado en el interior de su hogar ya que de esa manera se ahorra en gastos de alquiler .Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que se hizo muy conocida en la zona además de obtener buenos ingresos ecónomicos el cual le da la tranquilidad de brindar una buena educacíon a sus hijos.Este sería su préstamo número 02 con Kiva y se siente muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que recibe para avanzar con su negocio.
Con el préstamo de 800 nuevos soles, comprará diversos artículos como cuadernos, lapiceros, libros, etc. para surtir su  librería  considera que a mayor variedad mas acogida tendrá su negocio.
texts.en:
Jessica, 36, is married and has three children, ages 7, 10, and 16, for whom she strives to be successful. She lives comfortably in her own home.

Jessica makes a living selling books, notebooks, and pens, among other products. She has a business space installed within her home, so she saves on rental costs. What she likes about her work is that she has made herself very well-known in her area, and she also has a good financial income which gives her the comfort of providing her children with a good education. This will be her second Kiva loan, and she is very happy for the financial support that she is receiving to progress with her business.

With this loan of 800 Peruvian soles, she will buy a variety of items, such as notebooks, pens, books, etc. to stock her bookstore. She believes that with a greater variety of products, her business will be more welcoming.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pens, and books, among others.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 45 años de edad casada, luchadora, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación, junto a su esposo tienen 2 hijos los cuales el menor estudia en la escuela y el mayor le ayuda con las actividades del campo. Juntos en familia se dedican a la agricultura en la siembra de maíz, frijoles, hortaliza, Chile dulce, pepino, etc. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado un primer grado ya que sus padres eran de bajos recursos y no pudieron apoyarla, pero desde muy pequeña aprendió a trabajar la tierra dicha actividad fue enseñada por sus padres hace más de 38 años. Su producto es vendido y comercializado en los alrededores de su vivienda, en el mercado local y con algunos intermediarios mismos que califican su producto como un producto sano, no contaminado, ni adulterado con químicos u otros que hagan crecer de una forma acelerada.

Juana necesita ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes, abono y bomba de fumigación para sus cultivos de maíz ya que por medio de esto sus cultivos estarán protegidos de plagas, bichos y enfermedades.

Sus metas es poder mejorar su vivienda elaborando un repello y otros arreglos que necesita para que su estructura este mejor protegida. sus sueños son poder educar a sus hijos para que ellos tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida y no pasen por la situación de ellos.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old and married. She is a fighter and an enterprising woman with a desire to succeed. She and her husband have two children. The younger one is in school and the older one helps out with the farm activities. 

As a family, they make a living in agriculture by planting corn, beans, vegetables, sweet chilis, cucumber, etc. Juana went to primary school, but she did not finish after the first degree because her parents had a low income and were unable to support her. However, from a very young age, she learned to work on the field, and her parents taught her about farm activities more than 38 years ago. Her produce is sold and traded in a local market near her home by intermediaries who qualify her produce as healthy, uncontaminated and not treated with any chemicals to make it grow faster.

Juana needs help to buy fertilizer, manure, and a spraying pump for her corn crops, so that her crops will be protected from infestation, bugs, and disease. 

Her goal is to be able to improve her home by plastering the walls and making other improvements so that the structure will be better protected. Her dream is to be able to educate her children, so that they can have better opportunities in life and so that they do not go through the same situation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, and a spraying pump for her corn crops.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es: Doña ana de 40 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene 4 años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda como: frijoles, maiz, arroz, golosinas, aceite, entre otras cosas, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in a home they own. She has a store where she sells items of basic need, beans, milk, eggs and bread, among other things. She has had this business for 4 years and it has given her experience with sales, allowing her to improve her earnings. The business is located in her home. It is very well-known by the neighbors in the area. She has developed a large clientele, as she has the store stocked.  

She wants to grow the business and make a new investment, but she needs capital. For this reason she has asked for a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store, like beans, corn, rice, candy and oil, among other things. She promises that she will pay off the debt and she is also confident that she will give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, candy, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Esperanza de 58 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia ella se dedica a vender todo tipo de productos de uso personal, como perfumes, desodorantes, etc. con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar, Doña Esperanza solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas perfumes, cosmeticos, shampoos, desodorantes y todo lo necesario para acrecentar su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en:
Esperanza, age 58, lives with her husband in her own house.  She sells all types of personal use products like perfumes and deodorants, etc.  With the profits that she gets from her sales, and with the help of her husband, they manage to pay for the household expenses.

Esperanza is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy more perfumes, cosmetics, shampoos, deodorants, and everything she needs to make her business grow.  This way she will get better profits, and she will have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics, and shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nibi Margareth

texts.es:
La  Joven Nibi, de 24 años, vive en su casa de habitación en una aldea de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 04 años a la venta de lociones, desodorantes, cremas de pelo, champo, talcos, lociones de hombres,  etc.   
Nibi Su negocio está ubicado en su casa y también sale a vender a otros lugares cercanos de la zona, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que visita para ofrecerles sus productos.
Nibi está solicitando  el préstamo para la compra de más productos como cremas, lociones, champo, desodorantes, talcos, perfumes y lociones y así tener variedad que ofrecer a todos sus clientes  quiere compra al por mayor porque así encuentra mejores precios.
Nibi su sueño ampliar su negocio y fortalecerlo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril  del 2013.
texts.en:
Nibi, 24, lives in her house in a small town in San Lorenzo, in the southern part of Honduras.  She has made a living for four years selling lotion, deodorant, hair cream, shampoo, talcum power, lotion for men, etc.

Nibi's business is located in her house.  She also goes out to sell to other places near her area.  Her customers are neighbors and friends who visit to see her products.

Nibi's requesting the loan to buy more products, such as cream, lotion, shampoo, deodorant, talcum powder, and perfume, so she has a variety to offer all her customers.  She wants to buy in bulk because she'll get better prices.

Nibi's dream is to expand and strengthen her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, April 2013

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, shampoo, deodorant, talcum powder, and perfume

loans.name: 3.9.282.17.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Hằng is the leader of the three-member 3.9.282.17.Thiệu Dương solidarity group. She is 26 years old and married with two children. The family lives in Thieu Hoa, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

For the past three years Hằng has worked raising cattle and poultry. One of her most critical business difficulties concerns her lack of capital to improve it.

In 2010, Hằng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid three previous loans. Now she is applying for a 30,798,000 VND loan to be shared with her two group members. She will use her portion to buy chicks to raise and sell in the future.

With her profits Hằng hopes to buy land of her own, make enough money to provide for her children and buy more supplies for her business.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 60 years old, married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Delia has a business, making and selling candy in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 18,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her candy-making.

Delia has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to rent a space at the public market.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her candy-making.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is a 27-year-old married woman with three children, all currently in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Elsie has a general store in the Philippines.  She requested a 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory to sell, such as snack foods, soft drinks, biscuits, bread, and other groceries.  She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan in order to expand her business.  Elsie has been in this business for four years.  In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Parveen Group

texts.en:
Parveen (pictured with her hand raised) is a 57-year-old, married woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She lives with her husband, six sons, and two daughters. Her husband is diabetic, so she always worries about his health.

For five years, her husband has been running a wood shop, which is the only source of income for their family. All of her sons are very hardworking and help their father with his business.

Parveen is a member of two-person group. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband with his business. Specifically, she is seeking a loan so that her husband can purchase a wood-cutting machine and some wood-related materials such as wooden sheets, nails, glue, and chemicals for his shop. As they have no other source of income, with the help of this loan, her husband should be able to continue to operate his business, and with the profits he expects to generate, he would like to open a new shop for his son.

Parveen dreams of providing her children with bright futures and prays for her husband's good health. She says that BRAC provides benefits in the field of micro-finance, and she is very thankful to BRAC and Kiva for helping her.

loans.use: To purchase a wood-cutting machine and various materials (e.g., wooden sheets, nails, glue, and chemicals)

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 48-year-old, married woman living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She and her husband have two children.

To earn a living, she owns farmland and operates an agricultural business. Specifically, she plants and harvests corn for sale. She has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP per month from these activities.

She joined GDMPC in 2010 and is now requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer (such as manure) for her small crops. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer (e.g., manure) for her small crops

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 57 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Rosita has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to buy an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Recho

texts.en:
Recho lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has three children and has been doing this work for 12 years.  Her primary income sources are milk and eggs.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: poultry keeping and rearing dairy cows. Her biggest challenge is animal diseases. 

Recho was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan to which she replied, "It has friendly officers and offers good services."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session and she said, "It's important for our economy."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Recho said that it will Increase their source of income.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Recho owns cows and poultry but does not own pigs, a pump, a bicycle, a motorcycle, or an automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household mosquito nets but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, a sewing machine, a TV, or a DVD.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Sara Isabel

texts.es: Sara es una microempresaria que se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte de acarreo y venta de materiales de construcción, es casada, tiene dos hijos   09 años y uno de  30 años  respectivamente. Adquirió un nuevo medio de transporte lo cual quiere invertir el dinero una parte en la legalización del nuevo camión como es actualización de placas, seguro, compra de llantas etc.
texts.en:
Sara is a small businesswoman who provides hauling services and sells construction material.

She is married, and she has two children, ages 9 and 30.  

She got a new truck, and she wants to use part of the money for the legalization of the new truck.  She will do things like update the license plates, pay for insurance, and buy tires, etc.

loans.use: to update license plates, pay for insurance, and buy tires, etc.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is a 55-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have seven children, two of whom are in school.

She explains that she is a very hard working entrepreneur. Loida operates a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 32 years.

Loida is now requesting a loan in the amount of 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell. In the future, Loida would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college and to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional fish for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a 55-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She and her husband have six children.

For more than six years, she has been engaged in the hog-raising business. This is the source of her income, while her husband works as a farmer.

Valeriana is asking for a loan to buy feed and food supplements for her pigs. With the loan proceeds, she feels that she will be able to improve her business and to increase her income. In the future, Valeriana dreams of improving her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing feed and food supplements for her pigs

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida works hard to support her family. Leonida is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines. She explains that she has been in this business for three years.

Leonida is requesting a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase ingredients for her food production business. Leonida would like to improve and expand her business so that she can provide her family with a secure future.

loans.use: to improve and expand her food production business by purchasing additional ingredients

loans.name: Naheed

texts.en:
Naheed is a 41-year-old married woman and an enterprising woman with many dreams to fulfill. She lives in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Naheed has been in the business of clothes-selling for almost seven years. She purchases clothes from different areas and sells them in the main market at a profitable amount. 

Naheed is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband makes his living as a daily worker, and his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members. She faced many problems in her early married life; there were days when her children often slept without having had any food. But now her contribution to the family income is playing a vital role in fulfilling the needs of the family members. 

To cope with the increasing demand during the summer season, she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase a variety of clothes in different colors. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the improvement of her house. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes.

loans.name: Marcita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marcita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising chickens. Marcita is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her fruits and vegetables business.

Marcita has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 63 years old, married, and has six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a business, selling rope and native hats, in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Lucena requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.  She will use the loan to purchase more stock of rope and native hats, to resell. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan, to further build her business. Lucena would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rope and native hats, to resell

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is a fish and seafood vendor, from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has been engaged in the seafood business for more than 15 years.

Valeriana is asking for a loan to buy more seafood, like fish and seashells, or sea oysters. With this additional seafood, she will be able to sell more, thus increasing her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more seafood, like fish and seashells, or sea oysters, which she will resell to her customers

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store.  Anita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a business buying and selling tobacco in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of tobacco to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for 15 years now and earns additional income from pig fattening.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Syeeda

texts.en:
Syeeda is a 48-year-old, married woman. She explains that she is a hardworking and diligent woman. Her husband works as a spray painter in an auto mechanic workshop.

Syeeda has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan proceeds, her husband would like to buy some new spray paints and spray materials such as a spray paint machine and chemicals. His current stock of materials is almost finished, so he will be able to continue his work with the help of this loan.

Because this is the only source of income for their family, the loan is very important to them. Syeeda is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle paint-related materials for her husband's work

loans.name: Mehmooda

texts.en:
Mehmooda is a 43-year-old woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, alongside her husband and one daughter. She has been doing the business of selling school bags, for 13 years. Her sales are increasing with time.

She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She would purchase a new variety of school bags, so that her sales and net income would be increased. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC

loans.use: to purchase school bags, for selling purposes

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Antonia works hard to support her family.

She has a bread retail business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from selling frozen foods.  Antonia is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to buy more assorted breads to sell to her customers.

Antonia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more assorted breads to sell

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 55 years old, married, and has six children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a farm, to earn a living. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 2,000 PHP every month.

She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2010. Now, she has requested a loan of 4,500 PHP. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.  In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ferilizer, such as manure

loans.name: Mouhannad

texts.en:
Mouhannad is an Iraqi youth client. He is 25 years old, married, and has a single child. Mouhannad is the only provider for his family. He owns a small shop and specializes in selling women's outfits. He has gained his experience through working as an employee at a similar shop. After gaining all the needed experience, Mouhannad established his own business in 2009, and he has developed an excellent reputation in the surrounding area.

Mouhannad is requesting a Youth Loan of 2,400 USD, which he will use to pay the annual rent of his shop. Throughout this loan, Mouhannad will be able to provide a decent life for his family.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent of his clothing shop

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old, married, with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosalie has a business selling ice candy in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy ingredients for her ice candy.

Rosalie has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar, 28, is married and has three children who go to school. For the last three years he has been in the motorcycle transport business.

Omar is applying for a 40,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy another motorbike for his business. He intends to see that his business grows.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike for his business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married and has four school going children. She works hard to ensure her children are well supplied with the basics but her greatest challenge is food and school fees for her children. She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has a business of buying detergents for making soap and apart from that she does poultry farming which earns her other source of livelihood.  She is now requesting a loan of Ksh 10,000 to purchase detergent for making soap and sell to gain profit which will enable her to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase detergent for making soap

loans.name: Dzeri

texts.en:
Dzeri is a widowed woman with one child who attends school. Together with her child, she lives at their own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past one year, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation and stiff competition.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Dzombo

texts.en:
Dzombo is a married man with three children. All of his kids attend school, which is the reason for his hard work. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Dzombo has operated a kiosk business from home for the past five years selling to passersby and neighbours.

Dzombo wants to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents and rice with this 10,000 Kenyan shilling loan. His dream is to see his children get better educated and become important people in society.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, detergents and rice for his store

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en:
Gregory is a married man; he has four children, three of whom attend school. Gregory owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Gregory operates a vegetable stall business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators in his business.
 
With the KES 15,000 loan, he wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: Tima

texts.en:
Tima is married with two school-going children. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Tima has operated a clothes selling business for the past five years. She sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 30,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zuma

texts.en:
Zuma is 42, married and has four children, one of whom attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For over six years Zuma has sold tins at wholesale to his neighbors and passersby. He faces the challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transportation. 

Zuma decided to join Yehu to access its loans so he might boost his business. He is applying for a 30,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy additional tins[containers] to sell. His ambition is to establish a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional tins[containers] to sell.

loans.name: Shanga

texts.en:
Shanga is 34 years old, married, and has five children, three of his children attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Shanga operates a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and rice. Shanga also operates a poultry business where he earns his other source of income. He faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation and lack of enough capital in his business. 

With the KES 70,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, washing detergents and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu because of it's responsiveness to customers needs.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, rice, washing detergents and cooking fat

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a divorced mother of four children who attend school and are the reason for her hard work. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, Mejumaa has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cites lack of sufficient capital as her major challenge in the business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the loans of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase foodstuffs including wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs including wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and rice.

loans.name: Mbetsa

texts.en:
Mbetsa is a married man and has twelve children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.
