Su mayor sueño es terminar de pagar su vivienda en la que reside actualmente con su esposa.
texts.en:
Juan Eugenio, 48, makes a living selling beef and pork in a shop allocated by the town hall of his municipality. He says that he learned about this business from the age of eight thanks to his father, who worked in this trade for his entire life. 

At the age of 20, he started his own business, and over time he has managed to position it. With this work, he has provided for his two children, giving them a quality education.

He is applying for a loan to buy beef and pork, since his sales have increased for the month due to Mother's Day and he hopes to be able to guarantee a good service to his clients.

His greatest dream is to finish paying off the house in which he currently lives with his wife.

loans.use: to buy beef and pork.

loans.name: Gicheha

texts.en:
Gicheha is a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru. He benefited from the previous loan by being able to harvest farm outputs in good time and sold them at a profit. He was also able to cater for his family.

He has applied for his third loan from KADET Ltd. to enable him buy seeds and fertilizer after paying back his previous loan successfully.

He hopes to expand his farming business so as to be able to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: 04-10-11-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết has a retail business selling dry food. Tuyết has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Tuyết is 40 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent, the other two children are grown-up.

This is Tuyết’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase candies, biscuits and drinks to resell. Tuyết is the group leader of the 04-10-11-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

With her business profit, Tuyết hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase candies, biscuits and drinks to resell.

loans.name: Benjie

texts.en:
Benjie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Benjie successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Benjie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: 04-02-07-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup. Lan has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and eel to cook soup to sell.

Lan is 33 years old and she is married with two children. Lan lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. 

Lan is the group leader of the 04-02-07-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. This is Lan’s first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase rice and eel to cook soup to sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Araba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cassava, plantains and provisions in Wisdom Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 10 years. 

Araba is married and has two children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Araba will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, plantains and provisions, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Araba plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, plantains and provisions.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemi, de 36 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 04 hijos, ellos estudian y ayudan en las labores del hogar. Tiene una casa propia en donde comparte sus días a lado de su familia.Noemi se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, aceites, condimentos, verduras y otros productos de uso cotidiano como útiles escolares y productos de salud. Tiene una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa en donde atiende a  sus clientes desde muy temprano ofreciéndoles productos de calidad a precios cómodos acompañados de una atención amable y cordial. Trabaja sola y lo hace desde hace 5 años. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias económicas que obtiene. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500, por tanto agradece la oportunidad que le brindan para acceder al crédito que necesita para continuar con su trabajo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Con el monto solicitado comprará más productos para vender en su tienda entre ellos gaseosas, embutidos, arroz y azúcar.
texts.en:
Noemi is 36 years old, married and has four children. Her children go to school and help her with household chores. She owns her own house, where she shares her days with her family. 

Noemi makes a living in the sale of essential goods, such as rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, oils, condiments, vegetables and other products for daily use, such as healthcare products and school supplies. She has a small shop located in her house, where she serves customers from early in the morning, offering them good quality products for good prices with a friendly and cordial service. She has been working on her own for five years and finds her business profitable, because of the good profits she is able to make.

She is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN and she is thankful for the opportunity to access the credit she needs to continue with her work. She commits to making all the loan repayments on time. With the requested amount, she will buy more products to sell in her shop, such as soft drinks, sausages, rice and sugar.

loans.use: to buy rice, sausages, soft drinks and others

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and livestock for resale

loans.name: Abir

texts.en:
Abir is a 22-year-old Iraqi youth client, who is married and is a father of two children. Abir is the sole provider of the family.

Abir owns a small shop and specializes in crafting gallon containers for water made from aluminum. He has been in this field since 2005 and has gained much experience through practicing this business. Now Abir has hired an employee and has gained good reputation in his surrounding areas.

Abir is requesting a youth loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to buy piece of specialized equipment for his business as well as to increase his inventory. Abir is aiming to grow his business and improve his living standards so that he may provide good education for his children in the future.

loans.use: to buy a piece of specialized equipment for his business as well as to increase his inventory.

loans.name: Juan Fernándo

texts.es:
Juan Fernando de 33 años de edad, es un hombre soñador, su gran pasión es su familia y ver a su hijo en mejores condiciones de vida; es su gran reto.
Se dedica a las ventas ambulantes desde hace más de cinco años, actividad que se ha constituido en la única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia. 
Con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de dulcería. Espera que con dicha inversión, los ingresos mejoren al igual que su condición económica.
Su mayor sueño es crear un mercado autoservicios destinado a la comercialización de productos de la canasta familiar.
texts.en:
Juan Fernando, 33, is a dreamer whose greatest passion is his family and seeing his son in better living conditions. This is his greatest challenge.

He has made a living as a street vendor for more than five years, a business which has represented his only source of income to sustain his family.

With the goal of increasing his sales, he is applying for a loan to buy sweets. He hopes that with this investment, his earnings improve as well as his economic status.

His greatest dream is to create a self-service marketplace to sell staple products.

loans.use: to buy sweets.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar de 68 años de edad, es un hombre viudo y con tres hijos los cuales sacó adelante con esfuerzo y sacrificio. Desde joven se ha dedicado a la producción agrícola, principalmente al cultivo de flores en un lote de su propiedad en la vereda Sata Elena, Colombia. Su producto lo comercializa en la ciudad de Medellín. Labora diariamente de cinco de la mañana a  cinco de la tarde. 
Con el fin de ampliar su cultivo, Julio se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos  como semillas y abonos, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su mayor deseo es tener una vejez digna y sin carencias económicas.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar, 68, is a widower who has provided for his three children with effort and sacrifice. He has worked in agriculture from a young age, mainly cultivating flowers on a plot of his property in Santa Elena, Colombia. He sells his products in the city of Medellín. He works daily from 5 a.m. until 5 p.m.

With the goal of expanding his cultivation, Julio is applying for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. This will allow him to improve his earnings and his quality of life.

His greatest wish is to have a decent old age without financial hardship.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Julio Enrique

texts.es:
“Soy un hombre trabajador, he aprendido a laborar y a buscar el sustento dignamente” con estas palabras Julio de 40 años de edad, cuenta que desde hace 20 años se dedica a la venta de relojes, sombreros y lociones. Recorre constantemente las calles del municipio de Caucasia, Colombia, ofreciendo sus productos.
Sus dos hijos de cuatro y seis años de edad, son su mayor preocupación pues sueña con garantizarles una educación de calidad y mejores condiciones de vida.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de surtido con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
"I am a hardworking man, and I have learned to work and search for a livelihood with dignity." With these words, Julio, 40, says that he has been selling watches, hats, and lotion for twenty years. He travels constantly through the streets of the municipality of Caucasia, Colombia, offering his products for sale.

His two children, ages four and six, are his greatest concern, as he dreams of guaranteeing them a quality education and better living conditions.

He is currently applying for a loan to buy merchandise with the goal of increasing his sales and improving his earnings.

loans.use: to buy watches, hats, and lotion.

loans.name: Lisdelly

texts.es:
Lisdelly de 20 años de edad, es una joven apasionada por el mundo de los negocios. Cuenta que cuando terminó sus estudios académicos le propuso a su padre que montaran una tienda de sentimientos debido a la carencia de este tipo de negocio en el sector, por lo cual él accedió brindándole el capital para iniciar con su proyecto de empresa, Hoy lleva dos años realizando la actividad y se siente satisfecha por la acogida que ha tenido dentro del sector comercial en su localidad.
Con el fin de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en la fecha del día de madre, Lisdelly se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía. 
Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su negocio y comenzar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Lisdelly, 20, is passionate about the business world. She says that when she finished her academic studies, she proposed to father that they start a gift store, due to the lack of this type of business in their area. He agreed, giving her the capital to start her business project. She has now had this business for two years, and she feels satisfied with the welcome she has had within the commercial sector in her town.

With the goal of offering a greater variety of products for Mother's Day, Lisdelly is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise.

Her greatest dream is to see her business grow and to begin her university studies.

loans.use: to buy stuffed animals, writing paper, and chocolates, among other products.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en:
Genoveva is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of a 12-year-old son; she comes from Getafe, Bohol. Genoveva operates a 'sari-sari' or variety store business selling various goods to the people in her place. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Genoveva is asking for a loan to buy stock for her store like canned goods, snack foods, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries. With these, she will be able to improve her store and attract more buyers thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store like canned goods, snack foods, sodas and beverages, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic household items for his wife's general store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a jeepney transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her jeepney transport business.

Virginia successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further improve her business.

NWTF is re-listing Virginia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her jeepney transport.

loans.name: Israel Antonio

texts.es: Don Israel de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia cos su esposa y sus tres hijos,  se dedica a la agricultura específicamente al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene 15 años de trabajar en este rubro y se ha hecho de experiencia muy valiosa que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, el comercia sus cultivos en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela fija, estas personas siempre prefieren su producto pues es de buena calidad y a precios realmente accesibles, adicional a su trabajo en el campo también trabaja de albañil, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y con el pago de su trabajo como albañil logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar pero necesita invertir en insumos agricolas por eso solicta un credito que le permita comprar semillas, abono, insecticida, herramienta, etc y tambien para mejorar el terreno donde el cultiva que es el que muestra la fotografia para obtener las mejores cosechas y asi darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica
texts.en:
Israel, 37 years old, lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He works in agriculture; specifically, in the cultivation of corn and beans. He has 15 years experience in this work and his knowledge has been very valuable to him because it allows him to have better harvests. He sells the crops in the surrounding area and already has a large, regular customer base. These customers prefer his product due to the high quality and reasonable prices. 

In addition to his agricultural work, he also works in construction. With his income from both farming and construction, Israel is able to pay household expenses, but he also needs to invest in agricultural supplies. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so he can buy seeds, fertilizer, insecticide, tools, and other items. He will also improve the land where he plants and harvests, which is shown in the photo. This work will help him have better harvests and provide his family with improved economic stability.

loans.use: to improve the land where he will plant and to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es: Priscila, de 25 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de sus padres en una casa alquilada desde hace 10 años. Siempre fue una mujer independiente, cuidó de sus padres desde pequeña, “me gustaba mucho el campo y mis padres me enseñaron a cuidar la tierra. Me gustaba cuidar de ellos pues temía que se lastimaran”, comenta. Ese sentimiento la ayudó a forjarse una carrera, es por eso que en la actualidad trabaja en la capital como técnica en farmacia. En esa experiencia aprendió a sacar provecho y abrió su negocio de compra y venta de hortalizas y verduras. Una vez por semana traslada las verduras que cosechó de los terrenos de sus padres y los comercializa a un mayor precio en la capital. Su meta es poder crecer su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para poder seguir mejorando en sus estudios y también ayudando a sus padres.Este es el segundo préstamo con Kiva, agradece la oportunidad de progreso que le otorgaron pues de esa manera mejoró su nivel de vida. Razón por la que promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Priscila, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos, los cuales están a punto de madurara para su venta.
texts.en:
Priscila, aged 25, is a modest woman. She has lived with her parents in a rented house for ten years. She was always an independent woman, who helped her parents from a young age. "I really liked the countryside and my parents taught me to look after the land. I enjoyed looking after them because I was scared they would hurt themselves", she says. These feelings helped her to forge a career, and for this reason she now works in the capital as a pharmacy technician. 

She learned a lot from this experience and she opened a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. Once a week she transports the vegetables she has harvested from her parents land and sells them for a profit in the capital. Her aim is to build her business and increase her earnings to continue her studies and also help her parents. This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the opportunity to progress provided since it has helped her to improve her quality of life. This is why she promises to make her loan repayments on time.Priscila will invest the money in buying organic compost to feed her crops, which are almost ready for sale.

loans.use: to buy organic compost.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Even though Yaa grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Yaa is an entrepreneur. She sells kenkey, rice and vegetables in Wisdom Mpeasem (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 15 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their five children. 

Yaa sees that there are growing demands among consumers for her products, but she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more kenkey, rice and vegetables to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Yaa wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more kenkey, rice and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 47 years old and married with two children. Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, soft drinks and other groceries. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat. 

Rosario requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Rosario would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like vinegar, soy sauce, cooking oil, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vilma Esperanza

texts.es: Doña vilma de 37 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 5 años su principal siembra es el maiz y el frijol, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en casa propia, con las de ventas de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Vilma necesita contruir su vivienda en el terreno que muestra la fotografia pero con lo que gana no le es suficiente para realizarlo por eso solicita un credito para poder comprar materiales como cemento, ladrillos, hierro, arena, entre otras cosas y construir su vivienda que tanto ha querido y que por su estabilida economica no ha podido y asi puedan tener su casa y vivir mas protegidos con su familia.
texts.en: Vilma is 37 years old and has worked as in farming for 5 years. Her main crops are corn and beans. She lives with her husband and two children in her own home. She uses the profits from the sale of her crops to pay some of the household expenses. Vilma needs to build a home on the plot shown in the photograph, but she doesn't earn enough to finance this. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, bricks, iron and sand, to build a house that she has wanted for a long time but which her economic circumstances have not allowed. Then, they will have a better house in which to live together as a family.

loans.use: to buy materials to build her home.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more fabric and other clothing.

Teresita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Teresita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fabric and other materials.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 28 and married. He supports three members of his family. He has two children aged seven and three. Joshua is a livestock farmer in Kapsabet and has been in operation for a period of 12 years, earning a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

He has borrowed a second loan of 70,000 KES from KADET LTD with which he wishes to purchase livestock for resale. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan.

His dream is prosper in his livestock business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for trading.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie is 40 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosemarie has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Rosemarie has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other tools for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from making crafts out of shells. Teresita is borrowing 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marlefe

texts.en:
Marlefe is 23 years old, single, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last years by her retail business. 

She makes PHP 8,000 a month and is applying for a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

Marlefe joined GDMPC this year as a way to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Alihuseyn

texts.en:
Alihuseyn is a 46-year-old man. He is married and has three children, age 19, 18 and 17 years, and all are school graduates. 

Alihuseyn established his clothing business more than 16 years ago when his parents gave him some money to start petty trading. He began his business because he was not privileged to attend a tertiary institution because of lack of financial support, and the business is the only source of income of his family.

He would like a loan in the amount of 1,200 AZN in order to buy clothing for resale.

Frequent increases in the price of items are his main challenge, but by working hard, in the future he plans to rent a bigger shop, provide quality education for his children and build a house. This loan will help to increase his stock and thus generate more income. 

He is a hardworking businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Leanah

texts.en:
Leanah is a 34-year-old single lady with one child.

She has a beauty shop in Nairobi. She has been in the business for two years and she gets a monthly income of 60,000 shillings. 

This will be her first loan from KADET Ltd. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase beauty products like hand and body lotion, weaves, hair chemicals and hair piece earrings. In future she wants to be a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase hand and body lotion, weaves, hair chemicals and hair piece earrings.

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
This is Rhodora. She previously accessed a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and with her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for a new 15,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rhodora dreams that her business will last for a long time. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
Haydar is a 27-year-old married Iraqi youth client who is a father of a single child and works hard to provide for his family’s needs.

Haydar owns a small grocery store where he sells dairy products, canned foods, drinks, snacks and detergents. He established his business in 2010 and has gained good experience in this field. Now, Haydar has an employee hired and has gained an excellent reputation in his neighborhood.

Haydar is requesting a youth loan of $3,000. He will use this loan to buy two refrigerators and a motor generator. Haydar aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he may be able to provide for all of his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy two refrigerators and a motor generator.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is grateful for the loans she has previously received from the lenders. Her business is on the rise, and she was able to establish a mobile money transfer shop with the proceeds of the loans. She would like to increase the operations of the mobile money shop, which has been hampered by lack of funds.

Eunice is therefore applying for a loan of 101,000 Kenya shillings to increase the till money/float in the mobile money shop. She hopes to continue educating her children from the increased income.

loans.use: To increase the till money/float in the mobile money shop.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Don Adrian de 58 años de edad vive con su esposa, es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y maicillo con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra cubri algunos gastos de su hogar. Don Adrian esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar fertilizantes, semillas, abonos, pesticidas, herbicidas y herramientas para sus cultivos y tambien quierer darle una mejora la terreno que muestra en la fotografia pues ahi es donde siembra y esa es su unica fuente de trabajo y asi el podra obtener mejores cosechas que le dejaran buenas ganancias economicas y poder tener una mejor establidad economica con su esposa.
texts.en: Adrian is 58 years old and lives with his wife.  He is a hardworking and very responsible person with his home obligations.  He works cultivating corn and sorghum.  With the sales that he carries out of his harvests he manages to cover some of the household expenses.  Adrian is requesting a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers, seeds, manure, pesticides, herbicides and tools for his crops.  He also wants to make improvements to the land that is shown in the photograph since that is where he plants and that is his only source of work.  Thus he will be able to obtain better harvests that will leave him with good economic earnings and he will be able to have better economic stability together with his wife.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, pesticides, etc. and to improve the land he cultivates.

loans.name: Fuk

texts.en:
Fuk is a 41-year-old man married to Regina, and they have two children, Margareta, 6, and Fini, who is 4 years old. 

Fuk has been selling fish since 2005 with a starting capital of 500,000 IDR (Indonesian rupiah). His monthly income depends on the seasons. Due to seasonal variations, the price for him to purchase fish has increased, and in turn, he is asking for a loan from TLM in amount of IDR 4,500,000. The loan will be used to buy fish and also to pay for his children’s school fees. 

He hopes that his business will run well so he will be able to repay the loan and put his children through school.

loans.use: to purchase fish and to pay his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 48 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Victoria has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Victoria requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, sugar, spices, etc., for her food-production business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her food-vending business.

Victoria has been in this business for six years. Victoria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, sugar, spices, etc., for her food-production business.

loans.name: Kelvy Enrrique

texts.es:
El señor Kelvy tiene 28 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con el vive  su esposa quien le apoya en su actividad comercial. Su negocio es servicio de barbería,  trabajo que realiza desde hace 7 años en su comunidad donde vive. 
Don Kelvy su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico donde la fluidez de personas es en grandes cantidades esta en el centro de la ciudad donde vive y esto hace que tenga mucha demanda de clientes.
Don Kelvy trabaja desde hace mucho tiempo brindándoles sus servicios, el crédito lo necesita para la compra de silla de cortar pelo, maquina de cortar pelo, aceite, gelatina,  tijeras y accesorios variados. 
Don Kelvy el impacto esperado con el crédito, es que su negocio crezca y así de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes los cuales los visitan a diario porque brinda  calidad en su servicio.
Don Kelvy los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio propio y ser uno de los mejores de su ciudad al mismo tiempo generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para él y su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras - Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
Señor Kelvy is 28 years old, and lives in the south of Honduras with his wife, who helps him with his business. He works as a barber, a job he has had for seven years in the community in which he lives. 
Kelvy's business is located at a strategic point, where many people come and go, in the centre of the city where he lives. This means that he has a lot of customers.
Kelvy has worked offering his services for a long time. He needs the loan to buy a hairdressers chair, a razor, oil, gel, scissors and various accessories.
Kelvy hopes that the loan will enable his business to grow, so that he can satisfy the needs of every one of his customers, who visit him every day because of the high-quality service he offers. 
Kelvy's plan for the future is to continue growing his own business and be one of the best in his city, while making greater profits in order to improve he and his family's quality of life.

Choluteca, Honduras  April 2013.

loans.use: to buy a hairdresser's chair, a razor, oil, gel, scissors and various accessories for his business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia, de 51 años de edad,esta casada con Evaristo y tiene 5 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Alicia es la venta de comida ,razón por la cual trabaja todo el día. Durante las mañanas vende diversos desayunos ligeros como jugos, panes, té o huevos fritos.  Al acercarse la hora del almuerzo tiene diversos platillos como guisos, sopas y carnes asadas. Por las noches ofrece a la venta salchipapas, salchipollos, pescados y otras comidas regionales. Tiene su local implementado con algunas mesas y sillas en donde atiende a sus clientes. Trabaja en este negocio más de 5 años y lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo quien lo apoya en la atención y preparación de las comidad. Complementa sus potajes con frescas bebidas elaboradas con frutas tropicales o con gaseosas.Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos que necesita para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su pareja con ello. Comenta que tiene planes de ampliar su espacio laboral para poner más mesas y sillas, así atender a un mayor número de clientes.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2500, por tanto agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su acceso al préstamo que necesita para cumplir con sus objetivos laborales. 
Con el monto solicitado comprará mesas y sillas, así como ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas como papas, condimentos, arroz, aceite, carnes, pollos y verduras.
texts.en:
Alicia, 51 years old, is married to Evaristo and she has 5 children with whom she lives in her own house.  The activity that Alicia carries out is the sale of food and it is the reason that she works all day.  During the mornings she sells various light breakfast items like juices, breads, tea or fried eggs.  Upon nearing the lunch hour she has different dishes like stews, soups and roast meats.  In the evenings she offers for sale salchipapas (fried sausage and potatoes), salchipollos (fried sausage, potato and chicken), fish and other regional foods.  She has implemented her premises with some tables and chairs where she serves her customers.  She has worked in this business for more than five years and she does it with the help of her husband who supports it in the customer service and the preparation of the meals.  She complements her concoctions with fresh drinks made with tropical fruit or with soda.  

She likes her business as it generates for her the economic income that she needs in order to cover the household expenses and support her partner with it.  She says that she has plans for expanding her work space to put in more tables and chairs and thus cater to a larger number of customers.  On this occasion she requests 2,500 PEN, and so she is grateful to all of the people who make possible her access to the loan that she needs to fulfill her work objectives.  

With the amount requested she will buy tables, chairs and ingredients for the preparation of her meals like potatoes, condiments, rice, oil, meats, chicken and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase chairs, tables and ingredients to prepare her meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare arepas, traditional corn patties.

loans.name: Leonie Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LEONIE est composé de deux personnes qui appartiennent à une même confession religieuse. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Doris Mahudo est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Doris Mahudo est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Doris Mahudo n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Doris Mahudo est mariée à un certain Boris. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges du ménage, Doris Mahudo exerce comme activité la vente de produits divers( savons, huile végétale, etc.)depuis quatre ans. Doris Mahudo s’approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Doris Mahudo sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe LEONIE, un troixième crédit auprès de ALIDé.les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group LEONIE consists of two people who belong to the same religious domination. The representative is Doris Mahudo, seen with her hand raised in the photo. Doris Mahudo, age 29, lives in Benin. She never attended school. She is married to a man named Boris, and the couple have two dependent children who both go to school. 

To support the household, Doris Mahudo started selling various merchandise (soap, vegetable oil, etc.) four years ago. She buys her stock at a market in Benin. 

To achieve customer satisfaction and to bolster her sales and income, Doris Mahudo is seeking a third loan from ALIDé together with the other member of LEONIE. Both previous loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy various products (soap, vegetable oil, etc.) for resale.

loans.name: Tulio Enrique

texts.es:
Tulio de 66 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador. Su familia es su mayor bendición y la razón por la que se esfuerza diariamente a fin de brindarles  mejores condiciones de vida.
Labora diariamente en horas de la noche hasta la madrugada, vendiendo café y aromática en la terminal de transportes de la ciudad de Medellín.
Gracias a su trabajo puede conseguir el alimento y el dinero para el arriendo de su casa. Sueña con mejorar su condición económica, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos y termos para la venta de sus productos.
texts.en:
Tulio, age 66, is a hard-working man.  His family is his greatest blessing.  They are the reason that he works hard every day in order to give them better living conditions.

He works daily during the evening hours until the early morning selling coffee and herbal tea at the transportation terminal in the city of Medellín.

Thanks to his work, he is able to get food and the money to rent his house.

He dreams of improving his financial situation.  That is why he is requesting a loan to buy supplies and a thermos for the sale of his products.

loans.use: to buy supplies (coffee, tea, sugar) and a thermos.

loans.name: Geralyn

texts.en:
Geralyn is a 24-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children, from Talibon, Bohol. Geralyn runs a sari-sari or variety store business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Geralyn is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, soap, and toiletries. Through this loan, she will be able to attract more buyers in her store. Geralyn dreams of expanding her business and she wants to save money, so that she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like canned goods, noodles, biscuits, chips, soap, and toiletries.

loans.name: Noern's Group

texts.en:
Noern, 38, is married, with two children, residing in a rural village located in the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. One of her children is dependent and is still in school. 

For the last ten years, Noern has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland. Sometimes, her husband works for others for a fee. Her family’s daily income to meet the family's needs is about KHR 19,000. 

Noern has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Noern, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to get a high yield from her paddy, so as to make a better living and to keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra de 23 años de edad es una joven emprendedora y amante por la culinaria, su gran potencial y habilidad para la preparación de alimentos la han convertido en toda una microempresaria. A su corta edad, esta mujer ya se visiona como una gran chef. En la actualidad tiene su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de arepas rellenas, pero su gran sueño es seguir creciendo y poder abrir nuevos puntos de ventas. Con el fin de satisfacer el nivel de demanda que tiene actualmente, Sandra se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos (carnes, arepas, salsas y otros).
Espera seguir creciendo y por contribuirle a su familia para los gastos del hogar.
texts.en: Sandra is 23 years old, and is a young entrepreneur and a lover of cooking. Her great potential and ability to prepare food has made her a successful micro-entrepreneur. At her young age, this women already sees herself as a great chef. Today, she has her own business selling filled arepas, a traditional corn patty, but her biggest dream is to continue to grow and open new sales points. In order to satisfy the demand she has at the moment, Sandra is requesting a loan, which she will invest in buying ingredients (meat, arepas, sauces and other items). She hopes to continue to grow and be able to help her family with contributions to household expenses.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (meat, arepas, sauces and others).

loans.name: 04-10-05-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en: Liên is applying for a loan to buy meat and noodles to make soup to sell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling noodles. Liên has been involved in this business for three years. Liên is 39 years old, and she is married and has two children. Liên is the group leader of the 04-10-05-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of four members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. In 2010, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, in order to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is a lack of capital. With her business profits, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to buy meat and noodles to make soup to sell in her food stall/restaurant.

loans.name: Yolande N's Group

texts.fr:
Ce deux femmes qui composent ce groupe ont une bonne cohésion sociale et exercent pratiquement la même activité, qui est le commerce.
Yolande debout à droite de la photo, est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 1 garçon.
Elle fait comme activité le commerce de détail de détergents et l'élevage de poulets. Avec le prêt elle envisage d'acheter un carton de savon en poudre à 95 000f, un carton de savons pour une valeur de 100 000f. Elle va acheter aussi des poussins pour une valeur de 30 000f qu'elle va élever.
Les bénéfices générés lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. C'est qui règle les factures d'eau, d'électricité et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle gère aussi les frais médicaux.
texts.en:
These two women who make up this group have a strong social attachment and carry out much the same activity, which is trading. Yolande, who is standing on the right of the photo, is 43 years old. She is married and mother to one boy.

She has a retail trading activity selling detergents and also raises chickens. With the loan she is planning to buy a carton of powdered soap for 95,000 francs and a carton of soaps for 100,000 fancs. She is also going to buy chickens to the value of 30,000 francs that she will raise.

The profits she makes will enable her to improve her family's living conditions. She pays the water and electricity bills as well as her children's schooling costs. She also handles medical expenses.

loans.use: to buy a carton of powdered soap, a carton of soap and chickens.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Activas está en su ciclo número 16 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, la cual les ayuda a saber el nivel de ingresos de cada una. Es un grupo ya antiguo que se esfuerza por ir creciendo y sobresaliendo.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Patricia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel 3, es decir con buenos ingresos, lo cual pudo tener gracias al esfuerzo que esta haciendo, pero también es consciente de que debe seguir trabajando y esforzándose. Ella es peluquera y tiene un modesto negocio donde todos los días trabaja arduamente. Es por medio de ese negocio que ha podido ayudar a su familia para poder darles lo que necesitan y que no pasen por ningún tipo de privaciones. Ella quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y de esa forma seguir manteniendo su economía y a su familia.
La Sra. patricia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de materiales para utilizar en su peluquería, como ser tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, ruleros, peines y demás y de esa forma seguir invirtiendo en su plan de trabajo.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Activas [Active Women] is in its 16th semester of the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other get ahead.  They are doing the poverty elimination survey, which helps them to know each person's income level.  This is an established group that works hard to continue growing and getting ahead.

One of the members is Patricia, who, in her last survey, showed a poverty level within level 3.  That is, she has good income, which she was able to have thanks to the effort she is making, but she is aware that she needs to continue working and making an effort.  She is a hairdresser and has a modest business where she works hard everyday.  

It is through this business that she has been able to help her family to give them what they need and ensure that they not lack anything.  She wants to continue investing in her business, and in this way, continue maintaining her economic status and her family.

Patricia is applying for this loan to purchase materials to use in her hair salon, like dyes, shampoo, rinses, rollers, combs, and other items, and in this way, continue investing in her work plan.

loans.use: to buy dyes, shampoo, rinses, rollers, combs, and other items.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
This is Carolina, 47, a resident of Silang, Cavite Province, in the Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a driver, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Carolina owns and oversees the operations of their motorized tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit that will carry up to four passengers to their destinations within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a boundary (daily quota) to her every day. In her business, the regular customers are from the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day. To help her continue the operations of her business, she is applying for a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts and accessories, and also for the maintenance of their tricycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Carolina hopes that her business will continue to grow, and she dreams of a better life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and accessories for her motorized tricycle, and for maintenance.

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat is 46-year old hard-working housewife. She loves in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband, three daughters and two sons. Her husband is a security guard by profession, but his monthly income is not enough to meet the household expenses of his family. Therefore, for the past four years, he also drives a taxi at night. But he is not able to generate any income from the taxi, as its engine is not working properly and needs to be repaired. Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to pay the cost of repairing the engine of her husband's taxi. With the profits, her husband wants to open a new auto mechanic shop in the future. Musarat desires to provide a quality education to all her children, and she prays for the good health of her family and for the growth of her husband's business . She is very thankful to BRAC and Kiva.

loans.use: to meet the cost of repairing her husband’s taxi.

loans.name: Anwar Group

texts.en:
Anwar is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of four children. 

Anwar owns a small embroidery business in her house. Her embroidery cloths are liked by everyone. Presently, her stock of embroidery material is almost finished, therefore she is interested in purchasing a variety of embroidery materials, including colorful threads, beads, stones, needles, and clothes. 

For that purpose, Anwar, as a member of a two-person group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her business. 

With the profit, she wants to construct her own house. She hopes that she will earn sufficient profit, so that she could easily pay back the loan amount as well as construct her house. She is feeling very happy after taking the loan amount because this will help her to fulfill her needs. 

NOTE: In the picture, Anwar is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase embroidery material for her business.

loans.name: Yurani María

texts.es: Yurani de 26 años es madre de dos hijos de cinco y dos años de edad.  Considera que su mayor prioridad es la educación y la estabilidad emocional de su familia, por lo cual labora fuertemente a fin de garantizarles buenas condiciones de vida. Labora en la cafetería de un colegio en donde comercializa toda clase de fritos, mecatos y refrescos, actividad que se constituido en su fuente de ingresos. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido para mantener el stock y no reducir el  nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Yurani, 26, is a mother of two children who are five and two years old. She considers as her top priorities education and her family’s emotional stability and this is why she works hard in order to give them a good life.

Yurani works in a school cafeteria, where she sells fried food, snacks and beverages. This is her source of income. She is now requesting a loan to buy supplies to stock her business and maintain the current sales level.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare food, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Leila

texts.es: Leila es una señora emprendedora, tiene mucha experiencia en la producción de leche y productos lácteos. necesita de un préstamo de novecientos mil colones (900.000) para comprar dos vacas lecheras más y así aumentar la producción de leche. Ella sabe que contar con mas vacas es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo pero esta muy feliz por la oportunidad. Con esto mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia
texts.en: Leila is an entrepreneurial woman who has a lot of experience in the production of milk and dairy products. She needs a loan of 900,000 colones to purchase two milk producing cows so that she can increase her milk production. She knows that having more cows is a greater sacrifice and will be more demanding for her but she is happy to have this opportunity. With this support she will improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy milk producing cows.

loans.name: Santiago Isaac

texts.es:
Santiago es un campesino del municipio de Sonsón, Colombia y la agricultura se ha constituido en su única alternativa de vida para él y su familia, compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Desde hace años se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de arveja, papa y habichuela, productos que comercializa en la plaza de mercado de su municipio.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, insecticidas y fungicidas con el fin de mejorar su cosecha y sacar una producción más abundante y de mayor calidad.
Sueña con brindarle su familia una estabilidad económica y mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santiago is a  farmer from the town of Sonsón, Colombia, and agriculture has represented the only life choice for him and his family, comprising his wife and three young children. For years he has made a living growing and harvesting peas, potatoes and beans, produce that he sells in the market square of his town.
Today, he is requesting a loan that he will invest in buying agricultural products such as compost, insecticide and fungicide in order to improve his harvest and obtain a larger, higher quality yield. 
He dreams of providing his family with economic stability and better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (compost, insecticide, and fungicide).

loans.name: 01.06.09 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Nhàn operates a food stall/restaurant, selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to sell.

Nhàn is 36 years old and she is married, with two children. Nhàn is the group leader of the 01.06.09 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of five members. Nhan lives with two dependents and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Nhàn's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Nhàn has been involved in this business for one year. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to sell.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en:
Kareem is an Iraqi client, who is 53 years old, married, and has three children. Kareem is the sole provider for his family. 

Kareem owns a small grocery store where he offers to sell dairy products, drinks, canned food, oil, and detergents. He established his business in 2012. He gained good experience in this field and has gained an excellent reputation since he is the only grocer in the area.

Kareem is requesting a loan of USD 1,800. He will use this loan to buy a new refrigerator. Kareem believes that through this loan, he will be able to increase his sales and profits. By the increase of his profits, Kareem will be able to cover his children's school fees and help them achieve higher education levels.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his business.

loans.name: Monica

texts.pt:
Solteira e mãe de 2 filhos, dos quais 1 frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta a sua mãe que vive com ela.
É doméstica e tem casas de aluguer e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e adquirir uma viatura para o transporte pessoal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é trabalhar mais e investir numa machamba para produzir hortícolas e aumentar a sua renda.
texts.en:
Monica is single and the mother of 2 children, 1 of whom attends School. She lives in a house she owns and supports her mother who lives with her.

She's a maid and also has houses to rent. With this loan she plans to buy construction material (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to continue the building of her house.

In future, Monica hopes to finish her house and acquire a vehicle for personal transportation. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work even more and invest in land to farm and increase her income.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to continue the building of her house.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro de 26 años de edad, soltero del municipio de Managua, lugar que está ubicado en la zona central del país. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar con amigos de actividades recreativas como ir al cine, lamentablemente no puedo cursar una carrera universitaria por falta de recursos económicos. Pero le hubiera gustado estudiar ingeniería civil. 

Gracia a su empeño y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa como pantalones, faldas, camisas, camisetas, ropa interior, sabanas, short, vestidos. Tiene 15 años de desempeñar dicha actividad, el dedica a su negocio unas 9 horas diaria, en un lugar específico de la localidad. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Pedro José agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Pedro, 26, is single and lives in Managua, central region of the country. He likes to spend his free time with his friends going to the movies, for example. Unfortunately, he could not go to the university because he lacked the money, but he would have liked to study Civil Engineering.

Thanks to his hard work and will to succeed, he now works selling clothes (pants, skirts, shirts, t-shirts, underwear, sheets, shorts, dresses, etc.). He has been doing this for fifteen years and works approximately nine hours every day in his locality.

With this loan, he will invest in working capital and stock his business in order to receive a better income in the near future. Pedro José is grateful to Kiva lenders for the help they give to people with fewer resources from poor countries like Nicaragua, which gives them the opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock his business with pants, skirts, shirts, t-shirts and other garments.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis es una joven luchador, el desea mejorar la vivienda de su familia. Por lo que ha pedido un préstamo por doscientos cuarenta mil colones (250.000) con lo cual comprará los materiales necesarios para hacerle los arreglos a su casa. con esto pretende tener una vivienda mas digna y vivir mejor junto con su familia.
texts.en: Luis is a young fighter, and he would like to improve his family's housing.  For this, he has requested a loan of 250,000 colones, with which he will buy the necessary materials to make repairs to his house.  With this, he hopes to have a more respectable home and to live better with his family.

loans.use: to buy house construction materials.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is married and she works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marivic has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marivic aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Simel

texts.en:
Simel is an industrious gentleman, age 27, married, and supporting a family of six members. 

He learned about Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) from other farmers in his area who are already registered and being funded by KADET. Simel is a maize farmer and has been in the business for the last seven years, earning an income of KES 15,000.

Simel has acquired his first loan of KES 30,000 which will assist him in the purchase of fertilizer for his growing crops. He hopes to use the increased proceeds to be able to farm a bigger portion of his land.

His dream is to see his family's living standards improved.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Dino

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 1 filha que frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É enfermeiro e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e continuar com os estudos, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é se empenhar mais nos estudos e concluir a sua formação em psicologia.
texts.en:
Dino is married and the father of 1 daughter who goes to School, lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a nurse practitioner and with this loan he plans to buy construction material (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on his house.

In future Dino hopes to finish his house and continue with his studies. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to work harder on his studies and complete his degree in psychology.

loans.use: buy construction material (cement, iron, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on his house.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, que frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É operária agrícola e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa e mobilar para melhor confortar a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de economizar mais para realizar todos os seus projectos.
texts.en:
Aurelia is married and the mother of 3 children who all go to School, she lives in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.

She's a farmer for a large company and with this loan she plans to buy construction material (blocks, cement, sand, stone and others) to continue the building work on her house.

In future she hopes to finish her house and furnish it to improve her family's level of comfort. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to save more to make her projects a reality.

loans.use: pretende comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, areia, pedra, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 3 filhos, que frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É pedreiro e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar um congelador para a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja construir um estabelecimento comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de trabalhar mais para iniciar o negócio e aumentar a sua renda.
texts.en:
Bernardo is married and the father of 3 children who all go to School. He lives in a house he owns and doesn't support anyone else.

He's a stonemason and with this loan he plans to buy a freezer for his house.

In future, Bernardo hopes to build a commercial establishment. To this end he commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to work more to start his business and increase his income.

loans.use: buy a freezer for his house.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es un agricultor muy emprendedor y con grandes deseos de superación, cultiva maíz y frijoles a los cuales necesita darle mantenimiento con fungicidas, insecticidas y abonos, y es para la compra de estos suministros y semillas de estos granos que está solicitando un crédito de un millón de colones (¢1.000.000), Jorge depende de esta actividad para sostener a su familia, manifiesta que por medio de este financiamiento saldrá adelante económicamente.
texts.en:
Jorge is a very enterprising farmer with a great desire to get ahead.  He grows corn and beans, which he needs to care for with fungicides, insecticides and fertilizers.  

It is for the purchase of these supplies and seeds for these grains that he is applying for a loan of one million colones (¢1.000.000).  Jorge depends on this business to support his family.  He claims that with this financing, he will get ahead economically.

loans.use: to buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Philiph

texts.en: Philiph is 28 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged one and two years old. Philiph is a farmer in Kapsabet who raises livestock and grows tea. He has been in business for four years, earning an income of KES 13,000. He has borrowed a third loan, of KES 50,000, from KADET LTD, and intends to use the money to till more land and raise more tea trees. The profits he earns from the sale of his farm produce will be saved for future use. His dream is that his farm will prosper.

loans.use: to till more land and plant tea trees.

loans.name: Ai's Group

texts.en:
Ai, 50, is married, with four children, residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. One of her children is a dependent and is still in school. 

To support the family, Ai has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for ten years, while her husband works as a blacksmith in a local area. Together, they can earn about KHR 33,000 per day and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

Ai has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles, while the other members have been with VisionFund Cambodia from one to three cycles. Ai completely paid back the loans with VisionFund Cambodia and successfully used the loans to better support her family. 

Now, she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use some of her portion to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland and some of it to spend on labor. Ai hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en: Imad, who is 42 years old, is a married and the father of six children. He and one of his children earn the family's income. Imad runs a small shop where he makes covers for car seats. He established his business in 2003 after gaining experience by working at a similar shop as an employee for several years. Today he has one employee, and his reputation is growing in his area. He is requesting a loan for $2,100 to pay his shop's annual rent and buy a modern sewing machine. Imad aims to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to take care of his family’s needs and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to pay rent and buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sina's Group

texts.en:
Sina is 57 years old and married, with five dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, earning a living through farming rice and planting corn. Together with her husband, they can earn about KHR 62,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.

This is Sina’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Sina has been a member of VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. 

Now, leading her group to apply for a loan, Sina will use some her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and some of it to spend on labor. Sina hopes to make more rice and to sell it for a good price, so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos, dos quais 2 frequentam Escola e os outros 3 já maiores de idade, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais uma neta que vive com ela.
É operária agrícola e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (tijoleira, lavatório, sanita, torneiras, e outros), para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa de banho interna. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua casa de banho, construir dependências para os seus filhos e um estabelecimento comercial para aumentar a sua renda, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de economizar mais o seu salário para pagar devidamente o empréstimo.
texts.en:
Leonor is married and the mother of 5 children, 2 of whom go to School and 3 who are already of age. She lives in a house she owns and supports a granddaughter who lives with her.

She's a farmer for a large company and with this loan she plans to buy construction material (bricks, sink, toilet, taps and others) to continue building her indoor toilet.

In future she hopes to finish the toilet and build small houses for her children and a commercial establishment to increase her income. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to save more of her salary in order to pay back the loan.

loans.use: buy construction material (bricks, sink, toilet, taps and others) to continue building her indoor toilet.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 3 filhos, todos maiores, vive na casa própria e sustenta mais 5 netos órfãos que vivem com ela.
É agricultora e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos agrícolas (sementes, adubos, fertilizantes, e culturas de milho, batata, milho e outros), para lançar na sua machamba. 
No futuro deseja fazer crescer a sua machamba produzindo em grandes quantidades e diversidades, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é de trabalhar mais e explorar novas áreas de produtos mais necessitados no mercado.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and the mother of 3 children who are all of age. She lives in a house she owns and supports 5 orphan grandchildren who live with her.

She's a farmer and with this loan she plans to buy farming products (seeds, fertilisers and starter crops for corn, potatoes and others) to start off her farm. 

In future, Rosa hopes to grow her farm by producing large quantities of varied products. To this end she commits to duly paying off the loan so as to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to work more and explore new products required on the market.

loans.use: buy farming products (seeds, fertilisers and starter crops for corn, potatoes and others) to start off her farm.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana Julia es una microempresaria de éxitos tiene 47 años de edad, casada y con tres hijos. Su negocio es la venta de tortillas, carne de res en su domicilio, les vende a los lugareños de su comunidad. Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a esa actividad lo que le ha valido sacar adelante a su familia. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  materia prima como maíz, cal, carne de res, hueso frijoles crudos etc.
texts.en: Ana Julia is a successful micro-entrepreneur who is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She makes a living selling tortillas and beans in her home. She sells them to neighbors. She has been in this business for ten years, which has enabled her to support her family. She will invest the loan in buying raw materials such as maize, lime, beef, beef bones, raw beans, etc.

loans.use: to invest in buying raw materials such as maize, lime, beef, beef bones, raw beans etc.

loans.name: Orfilia De Jesus

texts.es:
Orfilia de 58 años de edad, es una guerrera y una mujer digna de admiración.  Desde hace más de ocho años se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y a la comercialización de pastillas de hipoclorito. Actividades que realiza como única fuente de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará en la compra de hipoclorito para la fabricación de sus pastillas las cuales comercializa puerta a puerta en semana y los fines de semana labora vendiendo comidas rápidas.
Su mayor sueño en la actualidad es construir una vivienda de dos pisos, en el primero desea montar su negocio y en el segundo vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Fifty-eight year old Orfilia is a warrior and a woman worthy of admiration. For more than eight years she has earned a living selling fast food and hypochlorite (bleach) tablets. These activities provide the only source of income with which she supports her household. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase hypochlorite. This will be used to manufacture the bleach tablets that she sells door to door during the week. On weekends she works selling fast food. 

Her dream at the moment is to construct a two-story house. She would like to establish her business on the first floor and live with her family on the second.

loans.use: to purchase hypochlorite to manufacture bleach tablets.

loans.name: Nimrod

texts.en:
Nimrod is a 35-year-old man who is married to Erin and has five children: Yeni, who is ten and in grade four; Yohana who is nine and in the second grade; Adeputra, seven, who is in grade one; and Riniati and Imanuel who are just five and three.

In addition to being a laborer, Nimrod and his wife also sell “Cucur”, traditional cakes which are made of melted sugar. The problem the couple face is that they don't have a vehicle to distribute the cakes around their native island of Sabu.

Nimrod would like to buy a motorbike and he has applied for a loan from TLM for the amount of 7,000,000 Indonesian rupiahs (IDR) to purchase a second-hand one. He will use the motorbike to distribute cakes to schools and also offer a motorbike taxi service on the island. Nimrod hopes this venture will help provide his children with a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand motorbike for food deliveries

loans.name: Okari

texts.en:
Okari is a 41-year-old man, married to Hellen, and blessed with three children. He owns a curios shop and has been in this business for ten years. He gets a monthly income of KES 50,000 (Kenyan shillings).

This will be Okari's third loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). He plans to use the entire loan to purchase materials for making curios. He wants to expand the business and to educate his children. In the future, Okari wants to be a prosperous businessman.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make curios for his business.

loans.name: Marie Helene's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 26 femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été crée le 18 décembre 2008. Il est composé de femmes ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et exerçant pratiquement la même activité, qui est le commerce.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Suzanne est âgée de 51 ans. Elle célibataire et mère de 5 enfants dont 1 garçons.
Elle fait du commerce comme activité. Elle détient une cantine au lycée qui se trouve pas loin de son quartier. Elle y vend du thiakry, du jus de fruits, des beignets et du sandwich. Elle dépense tous les 25000f pour faire ses achats nécessaires. 
Les bénéfices obtenus lui permettent de prendre en charge sa famille. D'améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants
texts.en:
This group of 26 women belongs to a Banc Villageois created on December 18, 2008. It consists of women with a strong social bond, and who practically all work in trade. 

Suzanne, age 51, is the one standing at the far right with her hand raised. She is the single mother of five children, one of them a boy. She works in trade, and has a canteen at the college near her district where she sells thiakry (a West-African dessert made with millet), fruit juices, beignets and sandwiches. 

She will spend all of her 25,000f to purchase the necessary supplies. The profits earned will help her to support her family and to improve her children’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy millet, sugar, and other ingredients needed to prepare meals at her canteen.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESPOIR est composé de trois personnes qui sont des cohabitantes. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Pierrette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pierrette est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Pierrette  un peu fréquenté l’école. Pierrette ne vit plus avec son mari. Pierrette a deux enfants tous à sa charge. Pierrette vit seule avec ses enfants. Pierrette assure seule les besoins de sa famille. Afin de contribuer aux diverses charges de sa famille, Pierrette mène comme activité principale la vente des fruits depuis dix ans. De façon secondaire Pierrette vend de la nourriture(pâte de maïs, riz). Pierrette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu,  Pierrette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ESPOIR, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: The “Espoir” [“Hope”] group is composed of three individuals who live in the same house. They are requesting financial support from ALIDé for the second time, in order to expand their business. The group’s representative, by the name of Pierrette, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Pierrette is 38 years old and lives in Benin. She has had little formal schooling.
