Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Amontoundè sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAWUNAGOALO un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
MAWUNAGOALO is a group of three people who are sisters and friends from the same village. The group’s representative is Amontoundè (whose hand is raised in the photo). She is 37 years old and married to a man named Barthélémy. The couple have four children who all go to school, and one of them still in their care. Amontoundè did not go to school. She and her husband handle the various household responsibilities together. To that end, Amontoundè sells fabrics and dishes door-to-door. She buys her merchandise in a city of Benin. 

To better meet the needs of her growing clientele, and to bolster her profits, Amontoundè is seeking a new loan from ALIDé together with the other members of MAWUNAGOALO. All past loans were correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and dishes for resale.

loans.name: Divino Nino Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Divino Niño está conformado por 11 integrantes nueve mujeres y dos hombres, madres y padres con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas de caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal, a pesar que en la vida han tenido dificultades, lamentablemente no pudo cursar sus estudios y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos de la casa.

Gracias a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante Alba Justina es la coordinadora del banco y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles y en cantidades pequeña como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa, arroz, huevos, sopa en bolsas, frijoles, aceite pan, jugos, gaseosas. La rutina de trabajo de  Alba es de unas 10 horas diarias  ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible para surtir su pulpería, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda  obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal  Divino Nino agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua. Para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Divino Niño Communal Bank is made up of 11 members, 9 women and 2 men, mothers and fathers of 20 dependent children among them.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country.  These people describe themselves as hardworking and responsible with a desire for personal self-improvement despite the difficulties they've had in life.  Unfortunately they weren't able to continue their studies because they needed to work from a young age to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and desire to get ahead, Alba Justina is the coordinator of the bank.  Her job is a "pulpería" located in her house.  A pulpería is a small store that sells food items in small quantities such as packets of coffee, shampoo, or sauce, rice, eggs, packaged soup, beans, oil, bread, juice, and soda.  Alba's work routine is to sell her products some 10 hours a day.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business buying and selling food products for her grocery store so she can earn better income in the near future.

Divino Niño Communal Bank is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have a means for a decent job.

loans.use: to stock her store with food products

loans.name: Nelsis Argentina

texts.es:
La  Señora  Nelsis de 36 años, vive con su hijo en su casa de habitación ubicada en un barrio de San Lorenzo, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 08 años a la venta comida como ser pollo, tacos, enchiladas, yuca, tortillas con quesillo,  carne asada y jugos naturales, refrescos etc. 
Doña Nelsis su negocio está ubicado en una glorieta fuera de un colegio de la comunidad donde vive y a diario le visitan sus amigos y personas que transitan para comprar sus productos.  
Doña Nelsis el préstamo para la compra de mas carnes de pollo, res, papas, plátanos verdes, lechuga, repollo,  aguacate, condimentos, refrescos, galletas, churros etc. porque su clientela a aumentado y les están pidiendo  diversidad de productos y así poder obtener más ganancias 
Doña Nelsis con el apoyo de este préstamo espera poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y a la ves quiere que su negocio mejore y se uno de los mas reconocidos, su sueño comprase un terreno para su hijo.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Abril del 2013.
texts.en:
36-year-old Nelsis lives with her son in their home in the suburbs of a neighbourhood of San Lorenzo, in the south zone of Honduras.

For 8 years she has been working selling food like chicken, tacos, enchiladas, manioc, tortillas with cream cheese filling, roast meat and natural juices, soft drinks e.t.c. Nelsis' business is located in the square outside a high school of the community where she lives and everyday her friends and passers-by visit her to buy her products. 

The loan is to buy more chicken, beef, potatoes, green vegetables, lettuce, cabbage, avocado, condiments, soft drinks, biscuits, churros (a type of fried doughnut) e.t.c. because she is getting more customers and they have asked her for more variety in her products and this way she can earn more profits. Nelsis, with the support of this loan, hopes to satisfy the demand of her clients and at the same time wants her business to improve and be one of the most well-known.  Her dream is to buy a plot of land for her son.

loans.use: to buy chicken, beef, potatoes, green bananas, lettuce, cabbage, avocado, condiments, soft drinks, biscuits, churros (a type of fried doughnut) for her business.

loans.name: Marcus

texts.en:
Marcus, age 33, is an organic cacao farmer that lives in the beautiful village of Medina Bank, Toledo District. Medina Bank is located along Belize’s Southern Highway, just past the river of Golden stream. Marcus lives with his wife and their four children, age one to six.  

Marcus was inspired to start growing organic cacao by a local conservation trust that manages protected areas in the southern part of the country. He manages a cacao farm of two and half acres and about 1000 productive trees. Marcus notes that he does face certain challenges like pests – local leafcutter ants, birds, agouti – and diseases like black pod and monilia. Despite the difficulties Marcus is enthusiastic about slowly growing his cacao production. 

As the sole bread winner of his home, Marcus works part time jobs, cultivating and selling other crops such has beans, corn, plantain and fresh vegetables, leaving little time for the management of his cacao farm. This Kiva loan will allow Marcus to hire the much-needed help to clean his farm and get it ready for transplanting new seedlings. Cacao farms in Belize are literally in the middle of the jungle, and require cleaning about three times a year. Cleaning is the process of removing underbrush to clear access to trees or prepare a plot for planting. 

Marcos’ wife Luisa enjoys helping with harvesting and selling quality organic cacao to the buyers. The family puts a lot of importance on their children’s education to ensure they have options when it comes time to stand on their own and provide for their own families.

loans.use: To clean, prune and transplant Cacao

loans.name: 3.9.281.08.thiệu Dương Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hải works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Hải has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is 46 years old, and she is married with two children. Hải's children are grown up so Hải supports no dependents with her business in the Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hải is the group leader of the 3.9.281.08.Thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2012, Hải joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hải has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hải hopes to buy land of her own, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is 26 years old. She is a distributor who sells food. With the loan she has requested, she would like to add more rice and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to increase her volume as she saves more.

loans.use: To buy more rice and potatoes

loans.name: Miryam

texts.es: Miryam, de 38 años es una mujer soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres en la casa de los mismos desde que nació. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de ropa variada. Comenta que por las mañanas trabaja como profesora en la escuela de su localidad, pero por las tardes dedica su tiempo a la venta de ropa variada a los clientes que posee. Su trabajo consiste en comprar ropa importada, “a las personas les gusta más ese tipo de diseños”, afirma. Es así que tiene pedidos durante el mes y en épocas de festividades tiene más acogida, espera abrir una tienda y vender ropa importada de calidad para sus clientes y así poco a poco abrir un negocio grande y prospero.Este es el primer préstamo con KIVA, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que le brindan, así mismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Miryam, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de ropa variada para su venta.
texts.en:
Miryam is 38 years old and single. She lives with her parents in their house where she was born. For four years now she has been working selling a variety of clothing. During the mornings she works as a teacher in the school in her town, and in the afternoons she devotes her time to selling various articles of clothing to her customers. She buys imported clothing for her business, because she says “people prefer those types of designs.” She receives orders throughout the month, and during festivals she receives even more orders. She hopes to open a shop and sell imported, quality clothing to her customers, and to gradually grow her shop into a large and prosperous business.

This is Miryam’s first loan with Kiva. She says that she is grateful for the financial support and that she promises to make her payments on time. She will use the requested 1000 PEN to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Soumnos' Group

texts.en:
Soumnos resides in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Cambodia.  She is a 36-year-old mother of three children.  To support her living, she has been farming rice on two hectares of farmland.  Together, they can earn about 76,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs.   

This is the first loan for Soumnos with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  As the group leader, she plans to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland.  She hopes to increase her income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: 01.05.12 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Nhung is applying for a loan to purchase ingredients to make soup. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling soup.

Nhung is 56 years old and she is married with three children. She is the group leader of the 01.05.12 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of eight members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent; her other two children are grown up.

This is Nhung's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Nhung faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nhung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make soup.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
This is Adoracion. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy more fertilizer and garden inputs, and the loan also helped in their family's expenditures. She has been in this business for thirty-six years now. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 33,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Adoracion dreams that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and garden inputs for her business.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is a fisherman from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. This is the source of his income. 

Jerry is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. Through this, he will be able to improve his catch, thus allowing him to sell more fish to the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and other items.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine is 29 years old. She sells flour, and has been in the business for seven years. 

With the loan, she has wants to add more wheat flour and cooking oil. 

The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Neriza

texts.en:
This is Neriza. She previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better, as more items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Neriza hopes that her business will continue to be successful. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and she also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Chreb's Group

texts.en:
Chreb, 27, is married and lives with her husband and two children in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Both of her two children are dependents and under school-age. 

She and her husband are rice farmers who grow rice on a three-hectare of farmland. She has been in the rice farming business for ten years, earning about 10,000 KHR per day to feed her family.

Chreb’s group consists of three members who all are female. She is a first cycle client. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 each with VisionFund.  As the leader, Chreb is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. 

With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is still practicing mixed crop farming and the business is doing well. He is thankful to KADET LTD and Kiva for the financial support they extend to him. He was able to open a car washing business with the profit he got from selling his farm produce. He is now requesting for a second business loan to purchase car washing equipment for his car wash.

loans.use: to purchase car washing equipment.

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en:
A 51-year-old father of six children, Lon resides in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Two of his children are still in school. 

To support his living, he and his wife have been farming rice on a three-hectare plot of farmland. Together, they can earn about KHR 32,000 per day from the current business and can save about KHR 20,000 each day for future needs.  

This is the third loan for Lon with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. He successfully paid back the past loans, which have helped him to support his children’s education. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. 

As the leader, Lon will use his portion to buy seeds for his farmland and use a portion of it to spend on plowing the field. He hopes this loan will enable him to get a high crop yield from his rice paddy so as to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds for his farmland.

loans.name: Merveille Group

texts.fr: MERVEILLE est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante nommée Akossouwa Anasthasie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Akossouwa Anasthasie est mariée à un certain Félix. Akossouwa Anasthasie a fréquenté l’école jusqu'au niveau secondaire. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Akossouwa Anasthasie et son mari assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Akossouwa Anasthasie vend de l'huile à moteur à son domicile. Akossouwa Anasthasie s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le but de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuses et de se faire plus de profits, Akossouwa Anasthasie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres  membres du groupe MERVEILLE un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Merveille is a group consisting of three people who are friends. The representative named Akossouwa Anasthasie (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 44 years old. Akossouwa Anasthasie is married to a certain Félix. Akossouwa Anasthasie went to school up to the secondary level. The couple has two children in school and under their care. Akossouwa Anasthasie and her husband take care of the household responsibilities together. To cope with her different responsibilities, Akossouwa Anasthasie sells motor oil from her home. Akossouwa Anasthasie gets her supplies in a town of Bénin. With the goal of better responding to the demands of her more and more numerous clientele and to make more profits, Akossouwa Anasthasie is requesting a second loan from ALIDé together with the other members of the group Merveille. The first loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy motor oil.

loans.name: Doern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Doern is 31 years old and married with three children. She and her husband earn a living by growing rice on five hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 15 years, she manages to earn about 20,000 Cambodian Riels (KHR) per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is a group loan for Doern’s group, three of whom are female, and she started with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Doern, who is the group leader, is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields and earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is 27 years old and single. He is a motorcyclist and has been using a motorbike as transportation for two years. 

He has requested a loan to repair his motorbike in order to have it in better working condition. The profits from the business will be used to buy another motorbike to use in transportation, as another source of income.

loans.use: To pay for motorcycle repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for preparing meals to sell, including rice, cassava, and plantains, among others.

loans.name: Adriana's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois dont fait partie ce groupe a été crée le 18 décembre 2008. Il est composé de 27 femmes ayant une bonne cohésion sociale et exerçant pratiquement la même activité, qui est le commerce.
Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, Aissatou est âgée de 47 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 1 fille. Elle fait comme activité le commerce, elle vend des vêtements, des chaussures, de l'encens et des pochettes. D'ailleurs avec le prêt reçu elle compte acheter des marchandises.
Les bénéfices générés lui permettent d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille en assurant à ses enfants une bonne alimentation, un habillement digne et assurer aussi leurs frais de scolarité
texts.en:
The "village bank" to which this group belongs was created on December 18, 2008. It consists of 27 women who have good social cohesion and are practically in the same business, which is trade.

Standing to the right in the photo and raising her hand, Aissatou is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children of whom 1 is a girl. She is in business selling clothing, shoes, incense and clutch bags. In fact with the loan received she plans to buy merchandise. The profits generated allow her to improve the living conditions of her family by ensuring her children have good nutrition, dignified clothing and also paying for their school fees.

loans.use: to buy pairs of shoes, bags, outfits, clutch bags and incense.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Pheap, aged 38 years, is married and has four kids. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Battambang province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living through planting rice and raising pigs. They have been in this business for 18 years. Together, they can earn about 14,000 KHR per day from the current business, and they manage to save about about 6,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Pheap has been with VisionFund for three previous loans. She completely paid back the past loans, which helped her to relieve her family’s financial burden. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. Pheap will use her portion for her farm: part to buy fertilizer, and part to pay for labor. She hopes to increase her family’s income and thereby to better her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for farm labor.

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is 33 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. All of her children are still in school. 

Sopheap and her husband are farmers who grow cassava on one hectare of farmland and sell grocery items in a village. Having been in this business for six years, together they can earn about KHR 52,000 per day.

Sopheap has been with VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund Cambodia for four cycles. Sopheap fully repaid the loans and she has successfully used the loans to better support her children's education. Now she is leading her group to take another loan. 

As the leader, Sopheap is going to use some of her portion to buy pesticides for her cassava and some of it to spend on labor to plow the field. She hopes to grow her business and make more crops, to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her cassava.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
This is Cristita, who previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

Cristita is requesting another 16,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit, profit that will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cristita dreams that her business will continue to be successful and that her children will all finish schooling. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeh es una señora con mucho experiencia y muy trabajadora. ella necesita aumentar la producción de ganado, por lo que necesita un préstamo de un millón de colones (1.000.000) para comprar mas ganado y así poder cumplir con las necesidades diarias para su familia.
texts.en: Elizabeth is a very hardworking woman with plenty of experience. She needs to increase her production of cattle, so she needs a loan of one million Costa Rican colones to buy more cattle. She will then be able to meet her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jesuvi Group

texts.fr: JESUVI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des voisines. La représentante du groupe, nommée Viviane est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo, est âgée 36 ans. Viviane est mariée à un certain Ignace. Viviane a deux enfants tous scolarisés. En plus de ses enfants, Viviane a un autre enfant à sa charge. Viviane n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges et assurer les besoins de ses enfants, Viviane vend des condiments et des crevettes depuis une dizaine d'années. De façon secondaire, Viviane vend des poissons fumés. Viviane s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Viviane s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe JESUVI pour consentir un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: Jesuvi is a group of three people whose members are neighbors. The representative of the group is named Viviane and is the one who has her hand raised in the photo and is 36 years old. Viviane is married to a certain Ignace. Viviane has two children both in school. In addition to her children, Viviane has another child under her care. Viviane did not go to school. To cope with her different responsibilities and ensure the needs of her children, Viviane has been selling condiments and shrimp for about 10 years. On the side, Viviane sells smoked fish. Viviane gets her supplies in a market in Bénin. With the goal of strengthening her business and of satisfying the demands of her clientele, Viviane partners with the other members of the group Jesuvi to request a second loan from ALIDé. The previous loan was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy shrimp and fish.

loans.name: Sari's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sari is aged 31 years and married. He has one son, who is still small. For the past several years, he has been farming rice on a two-hectare plot of farmland, while his wife sells grocery items to support the family. With the current business, he can earn about KHR 29,000 per day and can save about KHR 10,000 each day for future needs.

Sari has been a member of VisionFund for one previous loan cycle. He completely paid back the past loan, which helped him relieve his family’s burden and improved their livelihood. He is now leading his group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion of the loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to grow his rice fruitfully, so as to sell if for a good price and improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Omari

texts.en:
Omari is a divorced man and has nine children, all of whom attend school. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past ten years, he has operated a business selling dried fish, selling from home to his neighbours and passers-by. In addition, he is involved in a quarrying business, which is his other source of earnings and livelihood. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish, in the near future.

He originally decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business. He wants to pay school fees for his children, with this KES 20,000 loan.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 25 years old. He has been in business selling foodstuffs for one year. He has requested a loan for adding more sweet potatoes and cassava to the produce he has for sale. The profits from the business will be used as his source of income for the next academic year, because he wants to resume his studies.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes and cassava to sell

loans.name: Margareta

texts.en:
Margareta, a 37-year-old single woman, provides beauty services with house calls. Prior to opening the business, Margareta took a beautician course; with capital of IDR 500,000 she then bought some equipment to begin her enterprise. Most customers are those who live nearby.

Margareta has requested a loan of IDR 3, 000,000 from TLM to buy a hair straightening tool and other beauty products for her business; she expects that the loan will enable her to improve her operation, with the goal of establishing a permanent place of business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a hair straightening tool and other beauty products for her business.

loans.name: Khalfan

texts.en:
Khalfan lives in a small town in Kwale county. Kwale county is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help care for their families.  

Khalfan is married and has six children. Both he and his wife are farmers and are currently growing mangoes on their land. He is looking forward to beekeeping because he loves to eat honey and he is excited to start working with Honey Care Africa because their hive technicians give good service on beehives. 

This is Khalfan's first loan and he plans to use the income generated from his beehives to help make some improvements to his house. In the future, Khalfan hopes to save up enough money to start a tree plantation on his land.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás es protesista dental (elabora prótesis dentales) y padre soltero, vive con su hija en anticrético en la zona del Cementerio de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento de su familia.
Tomás requiere el crédito para la compra de materiales que reemplazen los empastes de amalgama que contienen mercurio ya que este es muy dañino para la salud y además los empastes de amalgama son una fuente no industrial de contaminación por mercurio que se considera un problema micro ambiental.
El sueño de Tomás es que su hija termine sus estudios y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Tomas is a maker of dental prostheses and a single father, who lives with his daughter in a rental house [under an 'anticretico' contract] in the Cemetery zone of La Paz city. He works more than 8 hours per day, since this is his only source of income for the family.

Tomas needs a loan to purchase materials to replace amalgam fillings that contain mercury, because this is harmful to health and, in addition, amalgam fillings are a non-industrial source of contamination due to their mercury, which also is considered a micro-environmental problem.

Tomas' dream is for his daughter to finish her studies and have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to replace ampules of amalgum that contains mercury, which is dangerous for patients' health.

loans.name: 02.03.04 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liệu works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle, and making rice wine. Liệu has been involved in this business for five years. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle, and rice for making rice wine.

Liệu is 61 years old, and she is married and has three children. Her children are grown up. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.

Liệu is the group leader of the 02.03.04 Đông Hải solidarity group, which is comprised of six members. This is the first loan for Liệu with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liệu hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to buy poultry, cattle, and rice for making rice wine

loans.name: Diane

texts.en: Diane is 28 years old. She has been selling foodstuffs for 5 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more beans, potatoes, and bananas for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 30 years old. She has been selling beans and sorghum for one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and sorghum to resell. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to resell

loans.name: Sot

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Sampov Meas district of Pursat province, Sot is 38 years old and married, with four children. Only three of them are dependent on her and are still in school. 

The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming and cassava planting while her husband supplements the income by fishing and working for others, for a fee. They have been in this business for 12 years. With the current business, she can earn about KHR 20,000 per day. 

Sot is in her fifth micro-loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. She fully repaid the past loans which have helped her better support her family with enough food. 

Now, she is applying for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and to use a portion of the loan to spend on labor costs. She hopes to grow her business, so as to improve her family’s condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Timoteo

texts.es: El Sr. Timoteo tiene 46 años,  el es pescador el vive en una isla Del lago Titicaca, centro turístico del departamento de La Paz donde ofrecen al público  artesanías  de totoras y en lana, la mayoría de los habitantes de esta isla se dedican a la pesca y el turismo,   este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Timoteo va a usar este préstamo para la compra de una bote pesquero de mayor capacidad su mercadería producto de su pesca lo venden en la ciudad de La Paz y con este nuevo bote  quiere incrementar su producción y así satisfacer la demandada de sus clientes, el Sr. Timoteo enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el viento que no le permite pescar por el olaje que levanta, el Sr. Timoteo es una persona  con ganas de superación se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado ya que esta es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para mantenerse.
texts.en:
Timoteo, 46, is a fisherman who lives on an island in Lake Titicaca, a touristic center of the department of La Paz where artisan crafts made of reeds and wool are offered to the public. The majority of the island's inhabitants work in fishing and tourism.

This is his second loan with the institution. Timoteo will use this loan to buy a fishing boat with a higher capacity. The product of his fishing is sold in the city of La Paz. With this new boat, he would like to improve his production and thus satisfy the demands of his clients.

Timoteo faces challenges in his business, such as the wind that keeps him from fishing because of the waves it produces. Timoteo is a person with a desire to succeed. He is happy and grateful to the institution for the support they have given him, because this is the only source of income he has to sustain himself.

loans.use: to buy a new boat to improve his fishing.

loans.name: Nov's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Nov is 31 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming rice to feed and support her family members. Having been in this business for 10 years, she is able to earn about 28,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day and manages to save about 10,000 each day for her future needs.

Nov is a fifth cycle client with VisionFund and she completely paid back the past loans. She smartly used the loans to gradually improve her living. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more rice so as to earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay”  la cual lo  constituye 06 socios entusiastas y trabajadores, teniendo en común de   mejorar  cada día por el bienestar de sus familias. Este es el caso de Elena de 56 años, es viuda y tiene 02 hijos independientes.  Lleva dedicándose hace mas de 20 años a la siembra y cosecha de palta y plátanos, donde luego lo distribuye en tiendas y mercados. Elena es una mujer que ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para apoyar a sus hijos en su educación. Actualmente sus ingresos lo destina para su siembra y algunos gastos de su hogar. Solicitó el crédito para sus cosechas, ya que tiene que pagar a sus trabajadores. Seguir trabajando positivamente es su mayor deseo. Elena junto al  grupo “Tayta Cruz De Muruhuay” agradecen el crédito brindado. Ella es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste polo color marón. Jorge no pudo estar presente por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
This is the Tayta Cruz de Muruhuay group, made up of six enthusiastic and hardworking members who have a common desire to improve every day on behalf of the well-being of their families.

This is the case of Elena, 56, a widow with two independent children.  She has worked for more than 20 years planting and harvesting avocados and bananas, which she then distributes to stores and markets.  Elena's a woman who has had to make an effort to support her children's education.  Currently she uses her income for planting and some household expenses.

She requested the loan for her harvest because she has to pay her workers.  His biggest desire is to continue working positively.

She and the Tayta Cruz de Muruhuay group are grateful for the loan offered.  She's the second one from the left, wearing a brown t-shirt.  Jorge wasn't able to be there because of work.

loans.use: to pay her workers

loans.name: Yadira Mercedes

texts.es: Yadira tiene un colmado que opera desde su casa desde hace ya 10 años. En estos años ha ido creciendo en su negocio y desea seguir haciéndolo y lograr tener en un futuro un local más grande para el mismo. Ella solicita un préstamo de 10,600 pesos para comprar algunos artículos de consumo para vender en el colmado y así aumentar su inventario. Algunos de estos productos son azúcar, arroz, refrescos, embutidos, habichuelas, aceite, productos enlatados, entre otros. Yadira es madre soltera de 4 hijos ya mayores de edad y su negocio le ha ayudado a sacarlos adelante. Sabe que cada inversión que hace en su negocio le produce un aumento en sus ventas y por ende en sus ganancias, con esto ella mejora cada vez más la calidad de vida que da a su familia.
texts.en:
Yadira has a grocery store that she has been running from her home for ten years. During these years, she has been growing her business and she hopes to continue doing so. In the future, she would like to have a larger property for her business. She has applied for a loan of 10,600 pesos to buy some consumer goods to sell in her store and thus expand her inventory. Some of these products are sugar, rice, soft drinks, cold cuts, beans, oil, and canned goods, among others.

Yadira is a single mother of four children, all of whom are grown. Her business has helped her to provide for them. She knows that every investment she makes in her business creates an increase in her sales and therefore in her earnings, with which she constantly improves the quality of life that she offers to her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, soft drinks, cold cuts, and other products to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Nkingis

texts.en:
Nkingis is 42 years old, married to Peninah, and a father of four children. For the last 11 years, he has farmed on his own piece of land and earns a good income. Wheat has proved to do well in his area, due to good climatic conditions. He learned about KADET LTD through posters. 

This will be his third loan. He plans to buy farm inputs and hire machinery for preparation of the land. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His future dreams are that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land, plant more wheat for commercial farming, buy his own farm machinery, and educate his children. He is a hardworking man who is focused on his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and hire machinery

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther, de 59 años de edad ,es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Francisco con quien tiene 3 hijos, pero solo cuidan al menor de todos, en la casa que compró hace 28 años.Desde muy joven aprendió a tejer y bordar, esa enseñanza le ayudó a subsistir en la vida, “con la venta de mis manualidades pude construir mi casa, sacar adelante a mis hijos”, afirma. Por ello hasta el día de hoy se dedica al tejido de chompas de lana y en principal de lana realizada por productos reciclables. Además de ese negocio borda faldas típicas de la zona, por lo que constantemente compra tela, pues su bordado se demora un promedio de 3 meses y el arte toma sus tiempo, por lo que necesita de mucha inversión. Este es su 6 crédito con Kiva ,  por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe, así mismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Esther, invertirá los S/. 3000 soles en la compra de lana y telas para seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Esther, 59, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband, Francisco, with whom she has three children. They take care of the youngest one in the house which she bought 28 years ago.

From a very young age, she learned to sew and embroider. This training helped her to survive in life. "By selling my crafts, I was able to construct my house and provide for my children," she says. Therefore, today she still makes a living knitting wool sweaters, mainly with recycled wool. In addition to this business, she embroiders traditional skirts from the region, for which she constantly buys fabric. Her embroidery takes about three months and the art takes time, so she needs plenty of investment. 

This is her sixth loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial support she has received. She also promises to pay her installments on time. Esther will invest these 3,000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of wool and fabric to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy wool and fabric.

loans.name: Teófilo

texts.es:
Teófilo es maestro albañil y vive con sus hijos en casa propia en un acabado de                                          ladrillo y piso de tierra, en la zona de Bajo Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja por más de ocho horas al día ya que es el único sustento de su familia.
Teófilo  requiere el crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción: comprara ladrillos, cemento, fierros  para construir una habitación más en su casa y de esta manera mejorara la calidad de vida de él y sus hijos.
El sueño de Teófilo es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Teófilo is a master builder and lives with his children in his own house, which is made with bricks and a dirt floor, in the area of Bajo Llojeta in the city of La Paz. He works for more than eight hours per day, as this is his family's only livelihood.

Teófilo needs this loan to buy construction materials. He will buy bricks, cement, and iron to build a room onto his house, improving his quality of life and that of his children.

Teófilo's dream is to finish building his house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and iron to build another room onto his house and make his family more comfortable.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John lives in a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast, near Tanzania. Inconsistent rains, especially recently, have made farming difficult, and the poverty rates in the county are above the Kenyan average. 

Beekeeping is somewhat new to Kwale, but the passion fruit farms and mangrove forests throughout the area provide excellent sources of nectar for bee colonies. Many farmers in the area have expressed excitement at the prospect of owning their own hives and having a second source of income from their honey to help them care for their families.  

John is married and has five children. Both he and his wife are farmers, and they have been farming for over thirty years. They are currently growing passion fruit and citrus on their land, as well as extremely delicious mangoes. John is excited to start beekeeping because the bees will help pollinate his passion fruit crops. 

This is John's first loan, and he plans to use the income generated from his hives to establish a banana plantation. In the future, John's hope is to help train other farmers in fruit cultivation techniques.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in a small town in Kwale County. Kwale County is located on the Kenyan coast near the border of Tanzania. While beekeeping has not historically been a major activity in the region, the mangrove swamps closer to the coast and large passion fruit farms inland provide bees with robust sources of nectar. Though most farmers in the area are new to beekeeping, many are very enthusiastic about keeping bees. 

Florence is married and has seven children. She has been farming for over thirty years, and is currently growing passion fruit on her land. She is also growing moringa, a tree whose leaves are incredibly nutritious and high in protein, and are used as feed to swiftly bulk up cattle. 

Florence is excited to start beekeeping because of the effect that pollination will have on her passion fruit crops. She is also looking forward to working with Honey Care because they give "good, detailed training."

This is Florence's first loan, and she plans to use the income generated from her hives to make improvements to her family's home. In the future, Florence hopes to expand her apiary to fifty beehives.

loans.use: to buy beehives for honey production.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 38 years old. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past eight years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate the house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab is taking out another Kiva loan of Kshs 50,000 to establish a tailoring business. With the loan, she wants to purchase cloth materials and needles, and to purchase a sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and needles, and to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Vorn's Group

texts.en:
Vorn, 48, is married and living with her family in a village of the Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has three children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. For the last twenty-five years, Vorn and her husband have been farming rice on one-hectare farmland as amain source of family’s income. Together, they can earn about 35,000KHR per day from the current business. 

Vorn has just joined Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, this cycle.  She is leading her group of four to apply for a loan. As a group leader, Vorn is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy iron sheets for her leaking charcoal store

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en: Francoise is 28 years old. She sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to buy more charcoal for sale. The profits from the business will be used to add more charcoal for sale.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sengheang

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sengheang is a 47-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is still dependent on her and in school. 

She and her husband earn a living through farming rice and planting cassava as the main source of the family’s income. They have been in this business for almost 20 years, earning about 44,000 KHR per day.

Sengheang is just with VisionFund in this cycle, and now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. 

She hopes to get a high crop yield from her plantation so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Doña Dominga vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida ella se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa  lo hace de forma ambulante en los mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de sus esposo logran cubrir los gastos que tiene en su hogar, Doña Dominga esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio con: faldas, blusas, pantalones, camisas entre otras cosas y asi obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor vida con su esposo.
texts.en: Dominga lives in her own house with her life partner. She is a street vendor and she engages in selling clothes of all kinds, working in all the markets of her community. She and her husband succeed in paying for their household expenses thanks to the income she earns with her activity and to her husband’s income. Dominga is requesting a loan to buy more products to stock up her inventory, such as skirts, blouses, trousers and shirts. This will help her earn a better income in order to achieve a better standard of living together with her husband.

loans.use: To buy skirts, blouses, trousers and shirts.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
This is Rufina, who previously accessed a 16,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase various fruits for her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

Rufina is now requesting another loan for 30,000 PHP to buy more garlic, grapes, oranges and other fruits for her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rufina hopes that her business will continue to grow, and dreams of having her own house and lot. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more garlic, grapes, oranges and other fruits for her business.

loans.name: Al-Taiar Group

texts.en: This group, Al-Taiar, consists of four ladies. They work in their businesses daily to increase their profits and provide a good living for their families. They live in Hodeida, Yemen. Together they have applied for a loan of 80,000 YER. Najah is a 29-year-old married woman who has five children. She sells ice cream. She started her business to assist her husband in providing for their family. This business allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She has requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to buy ice cream to expand her business. She hopes to expand her business to generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy ice cream to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products to sell in her general store: rice, plantains, beans, vegetables, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Felicita Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Felicita de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con suesposo y sus tre hijos es comerciante de frutas y verduras desde hace varios años eso le a dado la experiencia necesaria para poder tener su negocio vende en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio sus frutas y verduras. Doña Felicita solicita un prestamo para poder comprar ejotes,pepinos, papas, guineos, yucas, piñas, sandias y todo lo que necesita para acrecentar su negocio y asi tener sus a clientes satisfechos cuando la busquen para comprarle sus productos y ella podra tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Felicita is 61 years old. She lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for various years, thus gaining the necessary experience to run her own activity in the market of her community. She has many customers because she sells fruits and vegetables at a fair price. Felicita is requesting a loan in order to buy string beans, cucumbers, potatoes, bananas, cassavas, pineapples, watermelons and other products she needs to improve her activity. Her customers will consequently keep on being satisfied when they come to her stall to buy her products, and she will succeed in earning a better income that will help her granting a better standard of living to her family.

loans.use: To buy buy string beans, cucumbers, potatoes, bananas, cassavas, pineapples and watermelons.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan  tiene 30 años, casado tiene un hijo que tienen la edad de 10 años,  el se dedica  a la elaboración y  venta de queso y leche ya que tiene ganado vacuno, el vive en la localidad de Batallas, la gente de la población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Juan  utilizara  este préstamo para la compra  de una vaca lechera y quiere aprovechar esta oportunidad,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero  para la compra ya que esto le beneficiara de gran manera  ya que  proporcionara  buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y leche y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, El Sr. Juan  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado y su deseo es poder elaborar quesos por mayor y ofrecer a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en: Juan is 30 years old, he is married and he has a 10-year-old son. He breeds cattle and he engages in producing and selling cheese and milk. He lives in the Batallas, a community whose inhabitants engage in agriculture and animal husbandry. This is Juan’s first loan with our institution, and he will use it to buy a dairy cow. He wants to take advantage of this loan opportunity because he has not enough money to buy the cow, and this purchase will be of great benefit for him, as he will obtain more milk and will consequently succeed in producing more cheese and in having more milk to sell, thus improving his income. There are some challenges Juan has to face on a daily basis, such as buying fodder at a certain time of the year, and he will improve his cattle’s condition thanks to the benefits from the loan. He wishes to succeed in becoming a wholesale producer of cheese and to offer his products to the different markets of the town of La Paz.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 25 years old. She sells charcoal, and has been in this business for five years. 

Claudine would like a loan so that she can buy more bags of charcoal for resale. She is planning to use the profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
This is Veronica. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to buy fabrics for making clothes for both men and women. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

She would like to apply for another loan, this time for KES 50,000. She will use it to buy two sewing machines, to expand her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and to pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: To purchase two sewing machines.

loans.name: Anastasie

texts.en: Anastasie is 30 years old. She sells various items in her business. With the loan, she would like to buy corn flour and cooking oil to resell. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more corn flour and cooking oil to resell

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a 38-year-old, responsible mother of three children. Her husband died five years ago, and she has been doing a popcorn business since that time. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to expand her business. She would purchase a new popcorn machine, to fulfill the demands of the increasing number of customers. Her children are currently studying in schools, and she wants a better future for them. With her increased savings, she would send them to good schools.

loans.use: To purchase a popcorn machine

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 35 years old, a business lady and a widow. She is blessed with one child. Salome has been practicing poultry farming as her primary business and charcoal selling as her secondary business for the past one year with a monthly income of KES. 6,500 which she uses to provide for herself and her child.  

Salome is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy more chicks and poultry feed. With the anticipated profit from the business, she will invest for her child’s future needs. Her hope and dream is to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a firewood and charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passers-by. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to diversify to a transport business, and purchase a motorcycle for the business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to start her transport business.

loans.name: Margelis Del Socorro

texts.es: Margelis del Socorro de 30 años de edad, oriinaria de Chinandega, casada, con dos hijos menores de edad,  ambos están estudiando y que están a su cargo, ella desde hace once años emprendio la idea de instalar una venta en su casa donde habita, para la obtención de un ingreso familiar, y poder darles la manutención y educación necesaria a sus dos hijos, empezó con una pequeña venta, donde actualmente ya es una pulperia ofreciendo variedades de productos alimenticios básicos, para para el consumo de las familias, donde también ofrece mercadería general como es: ropa, calzado, chinelas, cosméticos, ella realiza sus compras de contado y vende de contado y también da crédito, ha decidido solicitar este préstamo, para capital de trabajo, ya que desea invertir mas en ambos negocios, para agrandarlo y generar mayores utilidades.
texts.en:
Margelis del Socorro, age 30, is from Chinandega.  She is married and has two minor children.  Both children go to school and are under her care.

Eleven years ago she undertook the idea of setting up sales at her house.  She did this to get family income and to give her two children the support and education that they need.  She started out with a small sales business.  

It is now a grocery store selling a variety of basic food products for family consumption.  She also sells general merchandise like clothes, shoes, slippers, and cosmetics.  She makes her purchases with cash, and she sells for cash and also on credit.

She has decided to request this loan for working capital.  She wishes to invest more in both businesses in order to make them larger and to generate greater profits.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her grocery store and her general merchandise sales.

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Devota is a married woman with seven children, five of whom still attend school while two are still under school age. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and school fees.

Devota operates second-hand clothes selling business. She sells at the market to town dwellers and her neighbours. She cites her major challenge to be the rate of stock turnover which is affected by seasons. 

With the loan of Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sophonie

texts.en: Sophonie is 33 years old. She sells various items in her boutique. With the loan, she would like buy more cooking oil, soap, and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil, soap and salt for sale.

loans.name: Liberathe

texts.en: Liberathe is 32 years old. She has been selling onions and carrots for the past 12 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more vegetables such as onions for sale. The profits from the business will be used for savings.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of four children and a responsible and hardworking housewife. Her husband is doing the business of construction material supplies. 

Zahida has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. With the help of the loan amount her husband will purchase bricks, cement and other construction materials and then sell them for a profitable amount in the main market. By doing so he will easily increase his net income and savings for the future. He is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for his business. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase construction material

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette sells charcoal and has been in the business for three years. She is married with six children. 

With the loan, she would buy more charcoal to sell.

The profit from the business will be used to pay the children’s school fees.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis  is a 32-year-old man married with two children; one of them goes to school.  Denis owns a  hair saloon, lodges, and a bar in town. He works five days a week .

He has applied for a loan of 3,000,000= to buy a pool table to entertain the different people who come to his lodges.   

He started his business in 2012 with the purpose of providing accommodations and a pool table for entertainment.  His customers are  people traveling between his home town, Ishaka, and the next town called Rukungiri. He also has clients from in and around the outskirts of his town. 

Denis hopes to modernize the place so it can become a leading sports and leisure center in town. The only challenge is incomes in the area are still low.

Denis is a hard working and trustworthy person.  He thanks UGAFODE Microfinance Limited for the quality financial support, and he  hopes for more services in the future.

loans.use: To buy a pool table for his business.

loans.name: Mado

texts.en:
Mado is 25 years old. She sells potatoes and is in the business of foodstuffs. She has requested the loan for adding more quantity of potatoes for sale. 

The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a single mother who lives in Likoni. She sells food, and is helped by her family. 

Her first loan was very beneficial for her, since she was able to buy vegetables and grains for preparing food. Before, she did not have enough capital to work with and the loan came when she needed it the most. She has paid the installments on time.

She always struggles to improve her food stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Bintihamisi is requesting a loan to establish another business of selling cooking pots made of clay and to purchase cooking pots of different designs for sale.

loans.use: to purchase cooking pots for resale.

loans.name: Peruth

texts.en: Peruth is 30 years old. She sells various items in her boutique. She has requested this loan to buy more cooking oil, rice and potatoes for resale. The profits from the business will be used for putting aside savings.

loans.use: To buy more rice and potatoes for sale.
